now Sugarcane beet growers be compensated by government price support cut targeted income payments over four years to payments cost estimated billion dlrs Myers administration sugar proposal expected to be introduced House Representatives next week by Rep John Porter R Ill Congressional sources program cut so drastic unlikely to be adopted either House or Senate because politically influential sugar corn growers high fructose corn syrup producers strongly resist direct payment plan outlined by administration targets subsidies to small cane beet growers gradually lowers payments over four years also excludes payment any output exceeding short tons raw sugar per grower example on first tons production grower receive cts per lb fiscal cts cts cts income payments be based on amount commercially recoverable sugar produced by farmer or crop years whichever less USDA Myers administration proposing drastic changes sugar program because current high price support causing adverse trends sugar industry He current program artificially stimulated domestic sugar corn sweetener production allowed corn sweeteners to make market inroads U S sugar consumption declined resulted progressive contraction sugar import quota to only one short tons year he hurt cane sugar refiners who rely on imported sugar processing Furthermore USDA current sugar program gives overseas text.title: STRIKE THREAT LOWER TRAFFIC MAR SEAWAY OPENING
text.author: By Jane Arraf Reuters
text.body: The St Lawrence Seaway set to reopen March after winter faces another tough year because depressed traffic levels possibility first strike years on Great Lakes seaway officials Depressed grain exports rising costs competing modes transportation all expected to result only marginal increase over year s traffic levels revenues on mile waterway officials season ran April to December seaway moved metric tons freight between Montreal Lake Ontario tons on Welland Canal linking Lake Erie Lake Ontario By comparison tons cargo traveled through Montreal Lake Ontario section through eight lock canal waterway expected to lose Canadian dlrs year same as estimated deficit fiscal ending March William Blair executive member Canada s St Lawrence Seaway Authority seaway moves one half Canada s exported grain Those exports single most important commodity carried on waterway been depressed by world surpluses Seafarers International Union represents workers on Great Lakes ocean coasts likely go on strike spring to protest employers demands wage rollbacks other concessions It s pct certain I guarantee you strike Roman Gralewicz head Seafarers Canadian branch Canadian government called labor conciliator to try to hammer out contract agreement between two sides seaway authority walkout tying up ships on Great Lakes badly hurt traffic We haven t strike on seaway years a prolonged strike disasterous effect Seaway Authority spokeswoman Gay Hemsley These heaviest contract talks history St Lawrence Seaway George Miller vice president Canadian Lake Carriers Association association major Canadian shipping companies recently workers current contract expires May association asking five per cent cut wages next three years reduced crew levels power to restructure crew dispatching association members recorded dlrs U S loss each due to lower traffic freight rates increasing competition seaway worst year two decades Hemsley seaway authority plans to raise tolls on Welland Canal by eight pct year compared to year s pct rise while maintaining freeze on tolls throughout rest waterway Canada responsible seaway s locks pct revenues maintenance costs We may see hope steady upward climb but we won t see major increase number years Hemsley Canada U S delegation to promote seaway to shippers Western Europe should result some increased traffic season but full benefits won t be felt several years Blair

text.title: WALL STREET SURVIVES TRIPLE EXPIRATIONS
text.author: By Cal Mankowski Reuters
text.body: The four times a year triple witching hour did jolt Wall Street as much as past Market averages finished sharply higher as stock index futures index options options on individual stocks expired simultaenously Some analysts warned part gain may be retraced next week But there were signs Wall Street getting used to phenomeon causes huge burst activity final minutes Officials New York Stock Exchange day went smoothly efficiently This been one few times consensus been right Jim Creber trader at Miller Tabak Hirsch Co He expects follow through Monday Tuesday to advance lifted Dow Jones Industrial Average points day points entire week Creber whose firm one first to get involved arbitrage activity involving index futures options general trend market been upward months Every time market comes somebody comes along more money he He investors adding to Individual Retirement Accounts prior to mid April tax deadline buying Japanese investors apparently helping push stocks higher Ron Feinstein analyst Dean Witter Reynolds Inc reports heavy Japanese buying just prior to end fiscal year Japan fueled bullish sentiment He investors who long positions stocks hedged short positions index futures rolled expiring March futures over into June contracts But he added different players other goals also were active there no simple explanation market s gyrations example Feinstein noted June contract June Standard Poor s stock index future hit minutes prior to close NYSE trading minutes contracted dipped to That could been wave selling institutional people making roll he first time nearby contract S P hit cash index closed at record It looks like market going to continue to go higher he Triple expirations didn t really mean much strong day stocks Steve Chronowitz Smith Barney Harris Upham Co Chronowitz stock market been underpinned by good solid buying interest cushion any pullback Other investors who were long futures short stocks bought stocks on close today instead rolling over Mark Zurack Goldman Sachs Co He cautioned against over dramatizing day s activity more reflection fundamental strength markets Leigh Stevens PaineWebber Group Inc what he saw mostly covering short positions stocks as index options individual options expired He there could be decline early next week stock market It looked like worked well today Howard Kramer asssistant director market regulation Securities Exchange Commission But he all data to be analyzed next week He there relatively little commotion at close shares changing hands final minute compared to triple expirations three months earlier He noted Dow industrials jumped points closing minutes modest move point index Kramer pointed out SEC NYSE measure to curb volatility disclosure market on close orders major stocks minutes prior to end trading showed imbalances modest proportions disclosures aimed at evening out volatility by attracting orders on opposite side imbalance data showed more buy orders than sell orders stocks preponderance sell orders only one stock no significant imbalance two stocks NYSE tightened rule governing what type market on close orders can be accepted final half hour

text.author: By Dean Lokken Reuters
text.body: Trade most urgent problem facing U S Canadian relations because pressing need to reach new bilateral pact within coming months Joe Clark Canadian secretary state external affairs Negotiators two countries been meeting more than year effort to work out agreement The most urgent problem now trade question because to be decided within next months Clark told Commonwealth Club California We fast track authority your Congress approval or rejection whatever negotiators achieve Clark as practical matter initial agreement must be reached by late September or early October He listed environmental questions particularly acid rain defense as second third most important bilateral issues facing Ottawa Washington On Wednesday President Reagan announced he seek billion dlrs Congress to address acid rain problem Some interpreted move as goodwill gesture advance his annual meeting on April Ottawa Prime Minister Brian Mulroney question and answer session public affairs group Clark two countries must find better mechanisms resolving their trade disputes This rash countervailing actions where we acted on corn you acted on soft wood we both they were quasijudicial dispute resolution mechanisims place now working adequately either our interests he Ottawa also seeking to change some Washington s rules on government procurement penalize Canadian businesses he There number Canadian companies order to secure substantial contracts United States to move their head offices out our country into your country because you national procurement requirements he turn he added United States like to change some procurement requirements exist at provincial government level Canada Clark declined to forecast outcome discussions What come out remains negotiators first instance to propose then governments congresses judge he his prepared remarks Clark United States tended to take Canada granted although exports to northern neighbor more than twice what exports to Japan Yet you bought almost per cent more Japan year than you bought Canada he

text.title: U S SENATORS SAY SANCTIONS LIKELY ON MICROCHIPS
text.author: By Jacqueline Frank Reuters
text.body: The United States likely impose sanctions soon on imports Japanese microchips senators today after private meeting Commerce Secretary Malcolm Baldrige Although senators Baldrige told them no decision be taken until final determination made on whether Japanese microchips were dumped United States they they were virtually sure Japan face penalties President Reagan s trade policy advisory group Baldrige member meet on issue Wednesday I am confident we see action taken Sen John McCain Arizona Republican told reporters I am expecting sanctions at least even more than sanctions Sen Pete Domenici New Mexico Republican senators several congressmen U S semiconductor industry representatives met Baldrige State Department officials to discuss Japan s alleged violations September agreement to stop dumping microchips United States other countries They recommended Japanese firms be penalized through tariffs or import duties over next six to months continuing to dump microchips violations were worth dls to Japanese semiconductor industry they Asked if Baldrige intended to recommend sanctions Sen Pete Wilson told reporters The clear import what he there be Japan can t just say they comply We think sanctions must be applied past violations agreement California Republican semiconductor industry produces microprocessor chips used high technology products ranging radios to defence missile guidance systems Sen James McClure Idaho Republican Baldrige told them administration made final determination Japanese companies dumped semiconductor microchips below cost production United States or other countries But McClure senators told him There no doubt dumping going on based on evidence such as invoices purchases Japanese products two countries signed pact September Japan agreed to stop selling microchips United States other countries below production costs to allow U S semiconductor industry access to Japanese market return United States waived right to impose import duties on Japanese microchips Japanese officials they lived up to pact asked Japanese chip makers to further slash output to save pact Japan frequently been target congressional discouragement over year s record billion dlr trade deficit Tokyo billion dlr surplus United States year large surpluses other countries Senate yesterday unanimously passed resolution calling action against Japan violations pact since September resolution be introduced House next week by Rep Bob Matsui California Democrat

text.title: ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT BOLIVIA
text.author: By Paul Iredale Reuters
text.body: Bolivia once Latin America s most delinquent debtor preparing second International Monetary Fund agreement after economic stabilisation program effectively slowed inflation reduced public spending fund spokesman IMF team visit La Paz shortly to discuss terms new agreement He IMF disbursed dlrs here dlrs pending under one year agreement ends month accord provided stand by loan compensatory financing facility structural adjustment facility spokesman if agreement renewed Bolivia can expect further mln dlr stand by loan over next months Bolivia s agreement IMF first since opened door to rescheduling negotiations Paris Club Argentina Brazil hold billion dlrs Bolivia s billion dlr foreign debt Central Bank President Javier Nogales told Reuters negotiations Paris Club yet to be finalised been extremely successful Nogales Paris Club agreed to reschedule Bolivia s debt over years five to six years grace waived all interest payments until end Bilateral discussions on interest rates continue he Nogales Bolivia expecting some dlrs disbursements year lender countries international agencies including World Bank Inter American Development Bank although diplomatic banking sources put figure at closer to dlrs Nogales Bolivia s net international reserves around dlrs up one dlrs when President Ictor Paz Estenssoro took office august Nogales capital flow on Bolivia s debt servicing versus new credits changed net outflow dlrs to net inflow dlrs Bolivia s return financial wilderness follows paz estenssoro s economic stabilisation program He inherited inflation pct year state enterprises were losing hundreds mlns dlrs currency traded on black market at up to times official rate Paz estenssoro froze public sector wages set market related rate peso introduced tax reforms laid off thousands workers state corporations Inflation been running at pct year past six months according to Central Bank government expects economy to grow three pct year after pct contraction over six years government also proposing novel solution to debt to commercial banks some dlrs on interest been paid since March Nogales over next few months Bolivia make one time offer to buy back all commercial debt at price trades on international secondary market cents on dlr He Bolivia s commercial bank steering committee agreed at meeting New York to consider proposal but still unclear what proportion country s creditor banks take up offer One foreign banker speculated Bolivia might be able to buy back up to pct commercial debt paper under deal mostly small banks who written off their loans to country But he larger creditors were more interested scheme debt equity swaps similar to operated Chile past two years Bolivian government yet to draw up proposals debt equity swaps but banker planning to privatise more than state companies these could serve as basis such scheme Foreign bankers type proposal might prove attractive to Bolivia long run especially as government realises to attract large amount new capital order to grow Planning Minister Gonzalo Sanchez de Lozada told Reuters Bolivia hoping five to six billion dlrs new investment over next to years government realises order to remain viable Bolivia need to develop new exports price tin accounted some pct Bolivia s exports collapsed on world markets gas country s major revenue earner abundant supply region

text.title: MAIN FEATURES OF NEW RUBBER PACT
text.body: The new International Natural Rubber Agreement INRA like pact use buffer stock as sole instrument market intervention excluding export quotas or production controls new INRA adopted yesterday at session held under auspices United Nations Conference on Trade Development UNCTAD many respects main features new pact resemble those contained present one reference price currently Malaysian Singapore cts per kilo be maintained unless between now October when INRA expires average daily market indicator price remains above upper intervention may sell price cts or below lower intervention may buy price cts six months If happened but delegates unlikely considering present indicator price averages cts price be revised under current accord by five pct or by whatever amount International Natural Rubber Council decides new reference price then be taken over new agreement Under same circumstances new pact reference price be automatically revised by five pct unless Council decides on higher percentage Similarly if buffer stock purchases or sales amounting to tonnes been made since revision reference price be lowered or raised by three pct unless Council decides on higher percentage Another change introduced new INRA price reviews be held at month intervals instead Those changes intended to make reference price more responsive to market trends As present accord may buy may sell levels set at plus or minus pct reference price must buy must sell levels at pct lower upper indicative prices floor ceiling prices remain fixed at cents unless Council decides to revise them at reviews held every months During negotiations consumers abandoned proposal floor price be adjusted downward if buffer stock currently tonnes rose to tonnes maximum size buffer stock new pact same as under present one tonnes provision additional contingency buffer stock tonnes Under new accord contingency buffer stock be brought at cts to defend floor price At Friday s session Ahmed Farouk speaking producers producing nations considered pact served purpose been created Gerard Guillonneau France who spoke consumers agreed current agreement worked relatively well Asked chances success new INRA delegates noted nearly whole life accord maintained average price above must buy level They agreement until now did appear to encouraged excessive production rubber addition provisions borrowing to finance buffer stock now been eliminated ruling out speculation It sort middle of the road agreement one delegate new pact be open signature at U N Headquarters New York May to December year To become operational require ratification by countries accounting pct world exports pct world imports Delegates estimate take to months now During hiatus between two agreements International Natural Rubber Council remain place pact enter into force definitively when governments accounting pct world exports pct world imports ratified

diplomats Conable who flew to Indonesia yesterday Tokyo meet President Suharto senior economic ministers He on arrival economy South East Asia s largest nation being managed well but slump world oil prices called major policy adjustments Today World Bank chief visit Bank funded projects eastern section Java Indonesia s most populous island He see Suharto on Tuesday after day detailed discussions ministers tomorrow Indonesia only Asian member OPEC been severely hit by year s crash oil prices cut oil gas revenues half Japan s state Export Import Bank month agreed to provide around dlrs untied credits to help Indonesia pay share World Bank development projects Indonesia country people responded to oil slump by cutting spending devaluing currency by pct trying to boost exports while using foreign loans to bridge deficit Diplomats Conable expected to press Suharto leading economic ministers to maintain pace policy change particularly dismantling Indonesia s high cost protected economy Oil prices debt crisis world recession all call major policy adjustments external support Conable his arrival statement But Indonesia facing parliamentary elections next month he likely to avoid anything imply Bank demanding specific changes We believe there been wise leadership here economy being very well managed Conable told reporters at Jakarta airport Indonesia official private overseas debts totalling billion dlrs according to Bank makes Third World s sixth biggest debtor received billion dlrs World Bank since Conable did spell out what further changes he like to see month Bank endorsed economic changes already introduced by Indonesia but implied wanted more Giving dlr loan balance payments support Bank monitor progress on implementation government s trade reform measures supported determination to promote efficiency longer term growth Indonesia introduced series measures since May to boost non oil exports liberalise trade encourage outside investment Suharto also ordered government committee to look into Indonesia s state run companies could be sold But report month U S Embassy government appeared divided over how far to take reforms Western analysts say particular government unsure how far to go dismantling Indonesia s high cost monopolies control core areas economy Central bank governor Arifin Siregar week Indonesia faced very limited economic choices could spend way out trouble because increase balance payments deficit domestic inflation He main objective to raise exports outside oil natural gas sector Indonesia s current account deficit projected by government to fall to billion dlrs coming financial year starts on April estimated billion

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC NIGERIA CHANGES AUCTI

text.title: NIGERIA CHANGES AUCTION RULES TO DEFEND THE NAIRA
text.author: By Nick Kotch Reuters
text.body: Nigeria s Central Bank changed rules governing foreign exchange auctions what analysts see as means defending naira currency depreciated steadily bank statement April banks bidding foreign exchange to pay at rate they offered as presently at rate lowest successful bid made at auction should discourage banks bidding high to ensure they were successful while paying lower marginal rate analysts It should act as brake because banks know if they bid high they to pay what they offered Western diplomat commented naira depreciated against dollar by pct since auctions known as Second Tier Foreign Exchange Market SFEM began September At week s session Nigerian currency fixed at to dollar third fall row They were clearly worried logical way trying to stop trend diplomat Central Bank also announced auctions be fortnightly weekly beginning on April immediately clear whether next Thursday s scheduled session still take place nor if bank planning to double dlrs normally on offer at each auction Demand foreign exchange consistently outstripped supply encouraging banks to bid high thus further weakening naira If normal weekly allocation doubled at fortnightly session high demand could undermine objective new system analysts Although bidding banks now pay what they offered official exchange rate naira applying to business transactions continue to be marginal rate lowest successful bid SFEM central part Nigeria s structural adjustment program considered to be most ambitious economic recovery plan Black Africa program involves setting realistic exchange rate naira over valued many years liberalising imports boosting agriculture removing subsidies reducing inefficient government participation economy World Bank played prominent part designing dramatic blue print selling to often sceptical public fears inflation lower living standards Ishrat Husain World Bank s representative Nigeria yesterday he satisfied both adjustment program as whole foreign exchange auctions So far so good he told meeting bankers Lagos adding only members Nigeria s import dependent elite suffer hardship while common man benefit Fears program encourage inflation were incorrect he Bumper harvests reduced rural inflation urban prices already reflected naira s black market value before currency allowed to find true level September

text.title: U S LATIN NATIONS DELAY DECISION ON IADB
text.author: By Peter Torday Reuters
text.body: The United States major Latin American nations agreed to set aside sharp differences over control Inter American Development Bank IADB reconsider issue summer bank s policy making board governors meeting here ahead week s IADB annual meetings put off any decisions when became apparent differences between Washington Latin countries ware too great IABD officials Washington indicated however might be prepared to compromise future United States principal donor nation pressed bank controlled by Latin American borrowing nations to cede virtual veto power over loans to Washington Reagan administration wants to make bank part controversial strategy to resolve debt crisis U S Plan calls loans multilateral banks like IADB to be tied to economic reforms debtor nations promote open markets reduced government intervention inflation free economic growth Brazil declared interest payments moratorium month leading challenge to Washington s strategy officials here obviously feared any decisions might deepen rifts between United States Third World nations IADB officials also Washington hinted at future compromise The U S remains hopeful they can reach agreement expressed optimism such consensus could be reached official who asked to be named Washington threatened to scuttle billion dlr four year capital replenishment bank if veto issue resolved But asked Congress to give authority to finance one third share event agreement on voting power reached United States controls pct vote wants loan veto to exist at pct level Currently simple majority can approve or disapprove loans giving borrowing nations control purse strings resulting loan conditions too lax Washington s taste U S Strategy dealing debt crisis expected to be repeated by Treasury Secretary James Baker speech to bank s annual meeting on Monday But monetary sources expect Baker to suggest United States some room compromise also to fend off other challenges to strategy by signalling Washington open to innovative solutions to debt problem

text.title: SAUDI ARABIA S KING FAHD VISITS BRITAIN THIS WEEK
text.author: By Deborah Telford Reuters
text.body: King Fahd Saudi Arabia begins four day state visit on Tuesday focus on redressing Britain s large trade surplus kingdom reaffirming ties between traditionally close countries British officials King Fahd may ask Britain to restore diplomatic relations Syria broken off by London October after evidence trial Nizar Hindawi showed Syrian agents were behind plan to bomb Israeli airliner But one official king be told Britain still needs clear sustainable evidence Syrians renounced state sponsored terrorism So far they haven t Britain stress support international peace conference on Middle East concern over alleged human rights abuses by Israel occupied West Bank Gaza officials told Reuters Saudi leader hold talks Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher meet Queen Elizabeth Prince Philip during visit his first to Britain since he assumed power June King Fahd be accompanied by his trade defence oil health ministers who hold talks their British counterparts Relations between two countries generally been warm But they were strained year by deportation British nurses kingdom illegal drinking publication letter by retired British ambassador describing Saudi Arabians as incompetent arrogant Saudi Arabia Britain s largest export market Middle East Britain exported billion stg worth goods to Saudi Arabia year while British imports country same period totalled Trade officials discuss what countertrade Britain can offer return Riyadh giving London biggest ever arms export order Under five billion stg deal signed year Saudi Arabia agreed to buy warplanes including Tornado fighters Saudi Oil Minister Hisham Nazer likely to discuss oil price stabilisation but Britain change refusal to limit North Sea oil production exports officials Saudi Arabia world s biggest oil exporter asked all oil producing countries to help stabilise oil prices at dlrs barrel by curbing output exports King Fahd s trip follows several visits to Saudi Arabia by British officials recent months Britain s Prince Charles Princess Diana went to Saudi Arabia November There were two previous state tours Britain by Saudi monarchs King Faisal visited King Khaled

text.title: SWISS BANKERS PLANNING COMPROMISE ON SECRECY CURBS
text.author: By Peter Conradi Reuters
text.body: Bankers concerned official calls curbs on Switzerland s banking secrecy likely to propose compromise plan when they meet regulators today Bankers Federation Secretary Andreas Hubschmid confirmed report yesterday s Sonntagsblick Federation make proposals to curb anonymity given to some bank clients who hide their identities behind lawyers or fiduciary agents The Sonntagsblick story goes right direction I cannot deny Hubschmid told Reuters Hubschmid declined to confirm details saying nothing yet been decided Recent allegations U S Officials involved arms for Iran scandal took advantage Swiss discretion to open accounts here added fuel to long running secrecy debate while Manila former Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos put fortune into banks here While Swiss banks strictly forbidden to reveal names their clients to outside world self governing code conduct dating requires bankers themselves know identities their clients But banking code due renewal October allows client to hide his name behind lawyer provided latter signs so called B form guaranteeing his client misusing his anonymity criminal purposes Commission at end year wanted use form drastically reduced bankers compromise plan Sonntagsblick quoting reliable sources aims to eliminate abuses by differentiating between lawyers who just manage portfolios their clients those who do so only as small part wider legal service Only second case use B form still be allowed Other clients to give up their anonymity reveal their identities to bank Commission President Hermann Bodenmann Commission likely to discuss proposal at today s meeting bankers during own council session on Tuesday He declined further comment banks draw up their own rules conduct But banking analysts banks cannot afford to ignore views Commission ultimately responsible preventing abuses

made next few days But bankers who attended meeting Gros inconclusive bankers also expressed disappointment Gros could give assurances as to when interest payments on billion dlrs medium long term debt restart It all very tentative You can t expect to get very far at first meeting one banker meeting took place on eve annual meeting here Inter American Development Bank most urgent item on yesterday s agenda need legal rollover some billion dlrs trade interbank credit lines extended to Brazilian banks expire at end March Brazil already frozen lines to ensure enough credit to finance day to day trade commerce but needs to request formal extension commitments to head off possible lawsuits disgruntled creditors issue whether bank steering committee endorse Brazil s request to creditor banks worldwide or simply relay without comment delicate question resolved at yesterday s meeting but lawyers both sides try to draft suitable language telex by midweek Gros bankers Gros he also formally ask banks day rollover some billion dlrs debt originally matured now due to be repaid on April Bankers request legal nicety since money subject to moratorium Once interest on Brazil s debts becomes more than days overdue U S Canadian banks must put loans on non performing basis may book payments only as when they received instead accruing interest advance Citicorp estimated profits first quarter be cut by dlrs if put Brazil on cash basis Other U S Banks also warned earnings setbacks Gros he wished day rule more flexible he be willing to sit down banks to see if there way round problem He did elaborate But asked whether bridge loan might be arranged to pay interest he It could happen Bankers possibility been raised at committee meeting dismissed as inconsistent Brazil s determination to find long term solution to problem servicing billion dlr foreign debt Gros himself pushing problem away days at time very useful Only if Brazil access to new loans can grow export pay debts over longer term If flow funds dries up country like Brazil can t meet all obligations he Gros defended Brazil s recent economic record noting inflation slowed February trade surplus rose public sector budget operational surplus But he there need to spell out government policy especially on prices It s necessary to clarify policy internal external reasons he but declined to say what economic measures might be introduced Once policy place Gros financing talks banks likely to be tough protracted sentiment echoed by country s creditors

text.title: IADB DISPUTE HIGHLIGHTS LATIN DEBT CONFLICTS
text.author: By Keith Grant Reuters
text.body: Controversy surrounding U S backed reforms Inter American Development Bank IADB underscores mounting challenge to Washington s current debt strategy according to Latin American officials delegates to IADB meeting begins here today bank s policy making board on Saturday postponed decision on reforms until June view strong Latin American opposition to U S Proposals to strengthen control over lending to region Washington wants to involve IADB debt strategy through increased lending but as bank s largest single shareholder also wants to require countries to adopt far reaching economic reforms to qualify loans U S Push IADB reforms began at year s meeting Costa Rica particularly sensitive institution Latin Americans traditionally thought as their own It s almost issue sovereignty Latin Americans one IADB official per cent voting bloc Latin American nations relatively easy access to billion dlrs project loans since bank s founding bank also been run past years by Mexican Antonio Ortiz Mena who been increasingly critical U S Debt strategy two years Ortiz Mena says commercial banks must renew lending to region if debtors to grow repay creditors At news conference week he warned Latin defaults were distinct possibility long run Brazil insists debt service obligations should no way interfere growth priorities position putting issue debt relief squarely into focus first time officials delegates They creditors ready to discuss debt forgiveness prefer to look at schemes such as debt equity swaps combination continuing emphasis on economic reforms Washington wants IADB to impose greater conditions on lending threatened to block increased appropriations bank if does get way Latin America while retaining reservations now accepts principle setting greater conditions on loans but unwilling to countenance U S Demands greater veto powers on lending officials delegates Washington pushed veto power to be lowered to pct simple majority as at present Latin Americans unwilling to go below pct oblige U S To line up two other voters or voting blocs on side attempt to weaken Latin America s voting power particularly threat by Washington to reduce funds to IADB unless reforms accepted created considerable resentment among Latin Americans Debtors already shown considerable willingness to sacrifice over five years so economic adjustment at issue one Latin American official region been hoping seventh replenishment IADB resources at least billion dlrs as against billion previous four year period

text.title: GERMAN BOND YIELDS SEEN FALLING IN NEAR TERM
text.author: By Alice Ratcliffe Reuters
text.body: West German bond yields could decline over next few months if recent efforts to stabilize exchange rates as seen month s Paris pact extend to keeping down European interest rates banking economists But longer term domestic yields could rise under agreements to stimulate West Germany s economy they Paris agreement so far successfully stabilized currencies threat central bank intervention economists Economists speculated G countries may try to bolster pact by uncoupling U S West German interest rates further when they meet IMF Interim Committee April The recent round monetary accommodation by Bundesbank Bank Japan firming Federal Funds rate significant They mark uncoupling movements U S foreign interest rates Salomon Bros Inc recent study narrowing international interest rate spreads major factor dollar s fall These spreads to be widened if dollar to be stabilized West German Bundesbank President Karl Otto Poehl encouraged U S to cut interest rates January when Bundesbank cut own rates by half point to avoid weakening dollar West German economists see room further cuts leading West German rates if dollar resumes decline It s taboo Peter Pietsch spokesman Commerzbank AG But most economists see room cut West German rates only first half year as re emerging inflation limit room manoeuvre later year Bundesbank s average yield public paper already nearing year s low week yields fell to around pct far low pct posted mid April Economists trend may cause domestic investors to shift some funds short to longer term paper Such move tend to flatten yield curve between short long term rates become more pronounced since Bundesbank lowered discount rate might also facilitate further cut leading rates as shift out savings accounts into securities slow growth Bundesbank s central bank money stock aggregate But conflicting trend plans to increase West German tax cuts part Paris currency pact designed to meet U S demands faster West German growth move may force interest rates up by creating revenue vacuum must be filled by higher government borrowing may occur if private sector demand credit remains weak but demand could emerge if rates begin rising Economists appeared government already stepped up borrowing year to accomodate revenue loss other sources including tax losses resulting weaker than expected economic growth higher than expected spending Josef Koerner chief economist West German Ifo Institut newspaper interview he expected tax revenue to be some billion marks below estimates by West German government November Any tax shortfall itself unlikely to push yields up But coupled other factors such as waning foreign speculative buying mark bonds on dollar s decline long term yields may to to rise economists Public authority borrowing may also rise owing to increases second phase Bonn s tax reform package West German government raising total tax cuts by billion marks to billion West German chancellor Helmut Kohl week increased borrowing to finance tax reform acceptable Finance minister Gerhard Stoltenberg Thursday he looking other ways to finance reform such as raising indirect taxes But few economists believe government be able to go through tax measures without increasing net borrowing Bundesbank February report wrong to believe first stage tax reform could be managed without increasing deficits Bundesbank West German public authorities borrowed large billion marks credit markets final quarter compared billion fourth quarter federal government took up nearly billion marks fourth quarter figures also drew on two billion marks Bundesbank advances at end year when required such credit quarter

text.body: U S Treasury Secretary James Baker any attempt to declare blanket debt forgiveness major Latin American debtor nations might damage world economy article Monday s edition Miami Herald Baker also criticised concept short term debt relief calling dramatic overnight solution While these ideas may be well intentioned some political appeal they impractical counterproductive long run he article published to coincide three day meeting here Inter American Development Bank IADB Baker chief architect U S Strategy on Third World debt Brazil Third World s largest debtor month declared moratorium on interest repayments given no indication when may resume interest payments prompting fears some large U S Banks may be forced into substantial debt writedowns calling into question viability U S Strategy Baker defending strategy private commercial banks rescheduled nearly billion dlrs debt since October at longer maturities lower interest rates Together expected progress commercial bank discussions Argentina we hope Brazil should add up to substantial new lending major Latin debtors Baker wrote He estimated debt equity conversion plans accounted billion dlrs year four region s major debtor states Such plans allow foreign bank creditors to sell Third World debt at discount to investors who then become stockholders firms these countries These swaps aren t panacea but they do demonstrate how creative free market can make progress reducing debt burden he

reuters.unknown: A f reute r f BC BRAZIL SEEKS TO REASS

text.title: BRAZIL SEEKS TO REASSURE BANKS ON DEBT SUSPENSION
text.body: Brazil wants to resume interest payments on medium long term foreign debt as soon as possible willing to discuss ways softening impact payments suspension on bank earnings central bank governor Francisco Gros Gros speaking to reporters yesterday after his first meeting Brazil s bank advisory committee since he appointed month also promised clear statement Brazil s economic policy be made next few days But bankers who attended meeting Gros inconclusive bankers also expressed disappointment Gros could give assurances as to when interest payments on billion dlrs medium long term debt restart It all very tentative You can t expect to get very far at first meeting one banker meeting took place on eve annual meeting here Inter American Development Bank most urgent item on yesterday s agenda need legal rollover some billion dlrs trade interbank credit lines extended to Brazilian banks expire at end March Brazil already frozen lines to ensure enough credit to finance day to day trade commerce but needs to request formal extension commitments to head off possible lawsuits disgruntled creditors issue whether bank steering committee endorse Brazil s request to creditor banks worldwide or simply relay without comment delicate question resolved at yesterday s meeting but lawyers both sides try to draft suitable language telex by midweek Gros bankers Gros he also formally ask banks day rollover some billion dlrs debt originally matured now due to be repaid on April Bankers request legal nicety since money subject to moratorium Once interest on Brazil s debts becomes more than days overdue U S Canadian banks must put loans on non performing basis may book payments only as when they received instead accruing interest advance Citicorp estimated profits first quarter be cut by dlrs if put Brazil on cash basis Other U S Banks also warned earnings setbacks Gros he wished day rule more flexible he be willing to sit down banks to see if there way round problem He did elaborate But asked whether bridge loan might be arranged to pay interest he It could happen Bankers possibility been raised at committee meeting dismissed as inconsistent Brazil s determination to find long term solution to problem servicing billion dlr foreign debt Gros himself pushing problem away days at time very useful Only if Brazil access to new loans can grow export pay debts over longer term If flow funds dries up country like Brazil can t meet all obligations he Gros defended Brazil s recent economic record noting inflation slowed February trade surplus rose public sector budget operational surplus But he there need to spell out government policy especially on prices It s necessary to clarify policy internal external reasons he but declined to say what economic measures might be introduced Once policy place Gros financing talks banks likely to be tough protracted sentiment echoed by country s creditors

reuters.unknown: F f reute r f BC NEXT WORLD TRADE NEGO

text.title: NEXT WORLD TRADE NEGOTIATIONS MUST SUCCEED NZ
text.author: By Christopher Pritchett Reuters
text.body: Ministers more than nations were told by New Zealand next international negotiations on liberalising trade be century cost failure could be measured Trade minister Mike Moore told his colleagues at welcoming ceremony before two days talks here great progress been made preparing negotiations must be sidetracked We live troubled dangerous times world trading system he We seen failure world trading system caused great depression conflict past Our failure to maintain momentum be at great cost to us all Moore The cost failure beyond calculation our hope best opportunity century We get another chance before year he added ministers New Zealand to review world trade since Uruguay round talks September talks also part preparations full scale June meeting General Agreement on Tariffs Trade GATT Venice Uruguay meeting considered by most countries to been particularly successful northern hemisphere countries managing to service industries such as banking insurance included next full round southerners goal including agricultural tropical products also met meeting at North Island tourist resort described by participants as informal no declaration expected Moore one aim to instil sense political urgency to avert potential economic tragedy Another to seek ways popularising freer trade to people who felt pain readjustment but could see benefits as well as preventing bush fires confrontation while we proceed orderly negotiations meeting being attended by overseas delegations including representatives GATT Economic Community delegates include U S Trade Representative Clayton Yeutter American sources say he ready to state best way to reverse protectionist sentiment United States to implement four key Uruguay proposals end to agricultural subsidies inclusion trade services investments GATT regulations tightening restrictions on pirating so called intellectual property such as trademarks patents copyrights new rules to resolve trade disputes among GATT s member states Earlier New Zealand sources French Foreign Trade Minister Michel Noir pulled out informal GATT talks domestic political reasons Cabinet chief Bernard Prauge lead French delegation

reuters.unknown: C T f reute u f BC CASH CRISIS HITS UGAN

text.title: CASH CRISIS HITS UGANDAN COFFEE BOARD
text.body: Uganda s state run Coffee Marketing Board CMB been suffering cash crisis past two months due to bottleneck export shipments administrative delays handling payments trade sources CMB needs between billion shillings the equivalent seven to dlrs to pay farmers processors coffee already delivered but present export revenue insufficient to cover such expenditure they board s cash crisis serious implications economy as whole since coffee accounts pct Uganda s total exports CMB s financial difficulties first started January following delays rail freighting export consignments coffee to ports Mombasa Dar es Salaam Tanga These delays were caused by shortage railway wagons Uganda bottlenecks on ferries transport Ugandan wagons across Lake Victoria to link up Kenyan Tanzanian railway systems sources Marketing Minister John Sebaana Kizito publicly acknowledged on February CMB run up arrears to local suppliers as result shortage transport moving exports Sebaana Kizito at time payments squeeze be resolved two weeks However accident to rail ferry plies between Ugandan lake port Jinja Kisumu Kenya put out action between February March causing fresh delays cargo movements Coffee exports especially sensitive to disruption rail transport since president Yoweri Museveni banned their haulage by road drive to save transport costs Transport difficulties meant by early February CMB holding unsold coffee stocks around bags These stocks were equivalent to one quarter Uganda s expected three kilo bag October September crop sources According to sources board s financial problems been aggravated by long delays processing export receipts coffee board taking eight weeks to recycle export receipts into payments to local producers whereas export bills handled by local banks took half time to process they sources CMB s price structure been overtaken by Uganda s high inflation rate unofficially estimated at pct further disincentive to producers already owed large arrears The coffee pricing structure wrong three months behind foreign exchange rate unrealistic sooner so called economic package put top gear better coffee industry economy as whole one sources government currently negotiating package economic reforms World Bank International Monetary Fund aimed at underpinning renewed inflow foreign aid to help Uganda s economic recovery after years political strife

reuters.unknown: A f reute r f BC ECONOMIST CALLS BRAZI

text.title: U S ECONOMIST CALLS BRAZIL DEBT REQUEST MODEST
text.body: Brazil s attempt to seek better terms paying off billion dlr foreign debt responsible modest former chairman President Reagan s Council Economic Advisers I think what Brazil calling limiting debt payments to two one half pct GNP responsible request on their part economist Martin Feldstein at weekend news conference It requires additional money on part banks but rather modest additional amounts Feldstein attending annual meeting Trilateral Commission foreign policy group more than business government leaders North America Europe Japan Feldstein one four members task force on Third World debt Brazil s request mean additional credit three billion to four billion dlrs banks international agencies Brazil s debt increase dollar terms but remain constant real terms four billion dlr increase Brazil s billion dlr debt represent no increase real inflation adjusted size liability he Feldstein he believed current Third World debt problems were less serious than those faced by international monetary system However European representative on task force Herve de Carmoy chief executive international Midland Bank PLC disagreed He called present situation more difficult draft proposal included task force s report suggested setting up institution possibly within World Bank fund could deal future debt crisis Commission discussions were closed to reporters but apparent news conference task force members did agree on all points their report One point agreement Feldstein debtor countries need additional credit coming years if they to enjoy satisfactory growth Feldstein task force also included Koei Narusawa economic adviser to president Bank Toyko Paul Krugman professor economics at Massachusetts Institute Technology did agree on how much credit be needed He they also did reach consensus on how willing international banks particularly those Japan Europe be to lend money Trilateral Commission set up by David Rockefeller former head Chase Manhattan bank others to promote closer cooperation among three regions

reuters.unknown: A f reute r f BC U S LATIN NATIONS D

text.title: U S LATIN NATIONS DELAY DECISION ON IADB
text.author: By Peter Torday Reuters
text.body: The United States major Latin American nations agreed to set aside sharp differences over control Inter American Development Bank IADB reconsider issue summer bank s policy making board governors meeting here ahead week s IADB annual meetings put off any decisions when became apparent differences between Washington Latin countries ware too great IADB officials Washington indicated however might be prepared to compromise future United States principal donor nation pressed bank controlled by Latin American borrowing nations to cede virtual veto power over loans to Washington Reagan administration wants to make bank part controversial strategy to resolve debt crisis U S Plan calls loans multilateral banks like IADB to be tied to economic reforms debtor nations promote open markets reduced government intervention inflation free economic growth Brazil declared interest payments moratorium month leading challenge to Washington s strategy officials here obviously feared any decisions might deepen rifts between United States Third World nations IADB officials also Washington hinted at future compromise The U S remains hopeful they can reach agreement expressed optimism such consensus could be reached official who asked to be named Washington threatened to scuttle billion dlr four year capital replenishment bank if veto issue resolved But asked Congress to give authority to finance one third share event agreement on voting power reached United States controls pct vote wants loan veto to exist at pct level Currently simple majority can approve or disapprove loans giving borrowing nations control purse strings resulting loan conditions too lax Washington s taste U S Strategy dealing debt crisis expected to be repeated by Treasury Secretary James Baker speech to bank s annual meeting today Monday But monetary sources expect Baker to suggest United States some room compromise also to fend off other challenges to strategy by signalling Washington open to innovative solutions to debt problem

reuters.unknown: V f reute u f BC BAKER EXPECTED TO DEF

text.title: BAKER EXPECTED TO DEFEND DEBT STRATEGY
text.author: By Peter Torday Reuters
text.body: Treasury Secretary James Baker facing toughest challenge to his Third World debt plan so far expected today to stoutly defend strategy At opening address to annual meeting Inter American Development Bank here Baker likely once again to bluntly reject alternative approaches like wholesale debt relief speech comes after Washington delayed bid to wrest control IADB lending Latin nations Treasury Secretary also expected U S officials say to portray attempt as crucial element his plan to promote inflation free economic growth open markets much reduced government role economies Latin America We already seen substantial progress Baker Miami Herald article argued plan never meant to be quick fix But Brazil Ecuador Peru Nicaragua Bolivia all ceased servicing some or all their debt Brazil s interest payments moratorium announced month being seen as major challenge to Baker plan Owing foreigners billion dlrs Brazil called indefinite interest payments moratorium on billion dlrs commercial bank debt Brazilian Central Banker Francisco Gros met bankers night to begin what U S officials predict be months extremely tough negotiations scale problem immense Owing some billion dlrs foreign debt Latin nations since start decade paid out some billion dlrs interest principal received billion dlrs new loans addition upwards billion dlrs capital flight estimated to left region during time Baker plan unveiled October calls on commercial multilateral banks to increase lending by billion dlrs three subsequent years to major debtors engaging fundamental economic reform theory runs once debtor nation reformed economy can service debt comfortably without atmosphere crisis U S officials emphasize some billion dlrs been paid out first months plan payments over billion dlrs debt been stretched out into future Washington embracing new innovative ideas to keep debtor creditor negotiations afloat Baker expected to underscore these points his address today

text.title: WORLD DEPENDENCY ON MIDEAST OIL SAID INEVITABLE
text.author: By TED d AFFLISIO Reuters
text.body: The world s dependency on Mideast as source petroleum growing nothing going to stop Donald K McIvor Exxon Corp XON Director senior vice president told Reuters interview Non OPEC production begin to decline gap between demand supply widen so trend to increasing dependence on OPEC Middle East inevitable McIvor Decreased supplies firm prices crude oil but likely to change growing dependence McIvor McIvor Exxon s senior vice president responsible oil gas exploration production dependence result Mideast s large spare capacity at time when rest world consumes more oil than finding Since we ve been consuming oil at rates billion barrels per year while making new discoveries only bilion barrels per year McIvor The bulk inventory more than half remaining proved reserves lies middle east producing at much less than current capacity he added McIvor some oil fields discovered so far only one one thousandth total number contained pct all oil ever discovered McIvor response to question he did believe there were any more super giants or oil fields reserves greater than five billion barrels to be found change conclusion world s growing dependency Of those super giants only lie outside Middle East Only five been discovered past years only two these lie outside middle east Cantarell Mexico Alaska s North Slope McIvor McIvor many large fields outside U S like Alaska s Prudhoe Bay North Sea were reaching peak soon begin to decline But Exxon executive there were still plenty opportunities to be explored developed outside Middle east particulartly Canada North Sea Australia Africa McIvor decisions to explore drill those areas be depedent upon both expectations higher price oil as well as legal regime affecting companies The ideal regime stable one one where there constant change policies McIvor McIvor he opposed import subsidies or tariffs used to increase exploration as these only benefit one part economy at expense other parts economy Asked options offered week by U S Energy Secretary Herrington to increase U S production McIvor he could comment on subjects like oil depletion allowance now but the thrust his Herrington report valid highlighted growing dependency on Middle east need to increase U S production McIvor also he expected natural gas to play greater role future meeting energy needs Natural gas opportunity to become increasingly important part worlkd s energy supply McIvor Crude oil be used more more as transportation fuel natural gas be used more to generate heat as industrial fuel he added

reuters.unknown: F f reute d f BC JAPAN IN LAST DITCH E

text.title: JAPAN IN LAST DITCH EFFORT TO SAVE CHIP PACT
text.author: By Rich Miller Reuters
text.body: Japan launched ditch effort to salvage computer micro chip pact United States sending letter to top American policy makers setting out case instructing producers to cut output further We must make our utmost effort to ward off any catastrophe Ministry International Trade Industry MITI Deputy Director General Masaji Yamamoto told reporters If hasty action taken United States create very serious problems Reagan Administration s Economic Policy expected to meet Thursday to review Japanese compliance bilateral agreement hammered out year Under pact Tokyo agreed to stop selling cut price chips world markets to increase imports American semiconductors Washington accused Japan reneging on deal by selling low priced chips Asia by failing to boost American imports threatened to take retaliatory action effort to save agreement MITI asking Japanese chip makers to limit production hope boost domestic demand reduce incentive to export Yamamoto Japan slash output kilobit dynamic random access erasable programmable read only memory chips by pct second quarter follows cutback more than pct first three months year He cutbacks were already drying up supply chips available export through unregulated distributors so called grey market We almost no grey market he Supply diminishing To help ensure cutbacks implemented MITI called president Japan s largest semiconductor maker NEC Corp NIPN T week he also issuing specific instructions on production to Japanese subsidiary Texas Instruments Inc Trade Industry Minister Hajime Tamura spelled out steps Japan taking to salvage pact appealed U S Understanding letter to top American policy makers letter sent today to U S Secretary State George Schultz Treasury Secretary James Baker Commerce Secretary Malcolm Baldrige U S Trade Representative Clayton Yeutter four who make up Economic Policy Council expected to consider evidence presented by U S Chip maker Micron Technology Inc DRAM O cut price Japanese sales Hong Kong Yamamoto admitted Oki Electric Industry Co s Hong Kong subsidiary sold chips at inappropriate level but denied dumping chips at rock bottom prices If United States uses as proof dumping We present our rebuttal he sales though were inappropriate light MITI s advice to semiconductor makers to sell chips at well above production costs to avoid any hint dumping he He also called case strange but he stopped short endorsing Japanese newspaper accusations Oki been trapped into making sales He did say though Micron publicized invoice documenting sales on same day they were made Oki unable to locate person who bought chips when tried to buy them back week

text.body: Because novel financing deal sold quickly week General Motors Corp s GM General Motors Acceptance Corp unit plans to do more multi tiered financings Michael Mangan GMAC We certainly happy transaction We plan to do more Mangan director corporate financing Offered on Wednesday dlr issue three price levels to attract wide range retail investors small regional institutions officers P W where securities were placed GMAC officer added Mangan co lead managers three different pricings enabled finance arm General Motors to borrow at attractive rates GMAC saved some basis points technique officer on Korth s syndicate desk Our all in cost comparable If deal made sense obviously we done Mangan noted GMAC seven year notes were given coupon pct investors buying less than dlrs notes offering priced at par to yield basis points over comparable Treasury securities Those buying to dlrs pay yield pct or basis points over Treasuries purchases more than dlrs notes carried price to yield pct or basis points over Treasuries contrast Ford Motor Co s F Ford Motor Credit Co unit month sold dlrs same maturity notes priced to yield pct or basis points over Treasuries Retail investors generally do see new issue product officer on PaineWebber s corporate syndicate desk They to buy securities secondary market Bond traders many corporates rose well above par secondary market year They attributed to huge number bond redemptions by issuing companies Institutions mutual funds seeing some their holdings called away They re scrambling to replace them one trader As result underwriters retail investors gladly sacrifice some yield spread over Treasuries if they could buy debt issues at or below par The GMAC financing seemed tailor made those retail investors commented one underwriter away syndicate GMAC s Mangan his firm also wanted to sell securities were aimed at retail sector Access to retail investors driving force behind multi tiered financing new market us so to speak Mangan There lot GMAC paper out there executive added referring to unit s past offerings One our basic strategies to target securities to specific investors hopefully attain broader distribution Officers Korth PaineWebber GMAC notes were selling quickly week although issue sold out by Friday afternoon In selling to retail investors or smaller institutions you to make lot more telephone calls investment banker pointed out Underwriters noted Korth PaineWebber along co managersG Edwards Thomson McKinnon strong retail bases They can carve out niche here one We plan to underwrite more these deals Korth official officer PaineWebber echoed sentiment Multi tiered financings relatively new wrinkle on Wall Street officer Korth he belives his firm underwrote first such issue eight or nine months ago Citicorp CCI GMAC s Mangan his company issued through Korth October dlr issue carried two different price levels But price gap between first second tier large Mangan our conversations underwriters we thought three different tiers make more sense because prices be far apart Meanwhile underwriting syndicates scheduled to bid competitively tomorrow dlrs first refunding mortgage bonds text.title: NAKASONE DEFENDS SALES TAX AS CAMPAIGNING BEGINS
text.author: By Yuko Nakamikado Reuters
text.body: Prime Minister Yasuhiro Nakasone defended his tax reform plans fierce opposition even within his own party as campaigning local elections began Our plan to reform nation s tax system by no means wrong Unless we reform system now Japan bound to decay perhaps within next years Nakasone told supporters his ruling Liberal Democratic Party LDP April elections be first nationwide vote since LDP s general election victory July Opposition parties shown rare unity joining to fight proposed five pct sales tax one main planks tax reform package now challenging LDP dominated local governments assemblies Tokyo incumbent Governor Shunichi Suzuki backed by LDP two centrist parties he cannot support sales tax as stands survey by National Broadcasting Corporation just over three weeks ago showed pct those polled they take tax Nakasone proposes to implement next January into consideration when they vote Takako Doi Chairwoman Japan Socialist Party speech central Tokyo where shop owners opposing tax The elections plebiscite against sales tax Your vote vote to force Nakasone to retract it LDP putting up own candidates only Iwate western Shimane but supporting independents jointly other parties other prefectures close aide to Nakasone who asked to be identified he sees sales tax having little impact on local elections since almost all candidates irrespective party affiliation opposing prefectural assembly polls

text.title: BAKER SAYS U S MAKING PROGRESS REFORMING IADB
text.body: U S Treasury Secretary James Baker he making progress negotiating reform Inter American Development Bank other member nations speech prepared delivery to annual meeting IADB Baker We making progress negotiating reforms he added if succesful Washington be ready to put up additional nine billion dlrs to seventh IADB four year capital replenishment increase pct immediately clear what overall size capital replenishment be if U S went ahead such capital increase But Baker s statement he made progress negotiating reforms came after weekend meeting bank s policy making board governors at reform issue put off until next June because deep differences between Washington Latin borrowing countries Baker U S increase account pct bank s useable financial resources Currently Washington only allowed to vote pct IADB board meetings considering loans to Latin American countries But Latin borrowing nations control pct vote frequently approve loans to economic reform conditions tied Baker pointed out Western nations provide pct bank s financial resources represent just pct vote Baker U S seeks greater say bank decisions itself other creditor countries In view imbalance we don t believe unreasonable to ask change Baker He changes sought by U S require loan approval by greater majority shares than simple majority But he stopped short reaffirming original U S position veto power should exist pct vote Enlarging on reforms Washington like to see Baker he wanted IADB to play much greater role U S debt strategy promoting inflation free economic growth open markets reduced government role economies debtor nations Under reforms he U S wants IADB to adopt major program lending to specific economic sectors debtor countries on condition countries carried out policy reforms those areas their economies Such reforms include among other things more concern natural resource management Baker lending should help debtors make transition to more open economies freer markets He also bank could double current lending volume capital triple concessional loans to poorest nations Treasury Secretary also called IADB to improve analysis policies debtor countries strengthening process assessing specific needs debtor nations He urged wholesale reorganization bank personnel Baker We simply believe more discretion policy influence should lie parties contribute lion s share resources He pointed out despite tight budget problems Reagan administration asked Congress to finance IADB other multilateral development banks Pointing out such funding difficult today best circumstances he be impossible if Congress did confidence bank lending policies

reuters.unknown: RM V A f reute b f BC BAKER URGES BANKS TO

text.title: BAKER URGES BANKS TO MULL NEW LOAN PLANS
text.body: Treasury Secretary James Baker urged commercial banks to be open to new ideas reducing third world debt burden I believe commercial banks need to be open to creative ideas reducing debt burden Baker told annual meeting Inter American Development Bank But he he confident banks make substantial new lending to major debtors year He pointed out principal debtor nations expected to grow average pct year fastest real rate growth since Saying U S debt strategy making substantial headway Baker import volumes debtor countries forecast to jump over six pct export volumes almost five pct best performance three years He also economic growth kept pace or surpassed growth debt nine major debtors since This start I venture to say good one Treasury Secretary he urged audience Western Latin finance officials bankers to stand fast against suggestions solutions like debt relief While such ideas political appeal Baker they mean drying up capital flowing to debtors even if free market reforms followed debt fogiveness frighten away investors who risk their capital country abandoned obligations he A debt forgiveness plan damages commercial banks also weakens confidence world financial stability He cautioned resolving debt situation be gradual painstaking process varying country to country Reporting on U S debt strategy Baker attitudes debtor nations changed there much greater acceptance free market reforms than hitherto Some countries like Argentina pursuing anti inflation programs Others like Philippines Chile privatizing companies swapping debt equity International Monetary Fund World Bank meanwhile committed nearly billion dlrs loans major debtor nations since late official creditors rescheduled billion dlrs outstanding loans through Paris club while commercial banks making new loans Baker pointed out banks rescheduld nearly billion dlrs debt reaching agreements recently Chile Venezuela Mexico Elsewhere his speech Baker outlined progress industrial nations making promoting moderate global growth low inflation efforts to reduce massive trade imbalances He maintained world economic conditions were continuuing to improve development provide positive backdrop debtor nations

reuters.unknown: F A RM f reute b f BC INDEX TRADING NOT TO

text.title: INDEX TRADING NOT TO BLAME FOR WALL STREET FALL
text.body: A report by U S Securities Exchange Commission SEC concluded index trading to blame two day stock market drop occurred Sept report made public today concluded index trading magnified but cause fall s two day point drop Dow Jones Industrial Index commission staff planned to continue to closely monitor developments index related trading but planned no immediate regulatory action as result precipitous stock market decline The magnitude September decline result changes investors perceptions fundamental economic conditions rather than artifical forces arising index related trading strategies report Nevertheless index related futures trading instrumental rapid transmission these changed investor perceptions to individual stock prices may condensed time period decline occurred SEC staff concluded study does provide independent basis to conclude radical regulatory or structural changes necessary at time report the dramatic growth size institutional use index products requires continued careful analysis potential disruption stock market as well as manipulative or other inappropriate trading index products their component stocks there may be merit to requiring additional reporting record keeping procedures index related trading But added SEC staff yet considered costs benefits various alternatives report does deal second precipitous dip market occurred Jan On day Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped points little more than hour SEC staff still analyzing underlying causes price decline yet made findings SEC study made after number investors news reports other analysts blamed Sept drop on so called program trading computers rapidly execute complex trading strategies designed to profit minute changes relationship between price stock index futures stocks make up index investors analysts complained such rapid movements stock market drive small investors out market possible even lead to stock market crash But SEC report possibility market collapse remote believed any rapid stock price decline likely eventually be reversed by renewed buying as prices reached far lower levels also argued index futures options important to traders who use them to hedge their market positions lessen risk exposure While cascade effect may be possible as result index related trading did ocur on Sept report concluded

text.body: Portugal s Agriculture Minister Alvaro Barreto he disagreed court order barring state grain buying agency EPAC taking part cereals import tenders open to private traders Barreto told reporters his aim to EPAC readmitted to tenders Under terms Portugal s January accession to European Community EC grain import monopoly held by EPAC Empresa Publica de Abastecimento de Cereais being reduced by pct annually until all imports liberalised Following legal proceedings by private importers Lisbon s civil court decided preliminary ruling earlier month EPAC should be allowed to take part as done tenders liberalised share annual grain imports As result ruling EPAC excluded March tender import tonnes maize Barreto My objective put EPAC into tenders because right to take part He added government be studying court order to see whether or ruling could stop EPAC participating future tenders Barreto there no reason to exclude any operator whether public or private tenders Private traders argued EPAC given dominant position Portuguese grain market unfair advantage over them There no reason to make EPAC martyr system Barreto He EC s executive commission accepted government s view EPAC should be eligible Lisbon court ruling stated EPAC s participation public tenders unfair competition violated clauses Portugal s EC accession treaty dealing gradual dismantling state agency s import monopoly

text.body: The Senate week might take up proposed legislation could serve as lightning rod to expose broad initiatives to change U S farm policy Senate could consider House passed bill allow wheat feedgrains farmers to receive at least pct their income support payments if flooding year prevented or prevent them planting their crops Senate staff members told Reuters Also pending bill extend life National Commission on Dairy Policy Sen Rudy Boschwitz R Minn intends to offer amendment to one bills suspend minimum planting requirement all wheat feedgrain cotton rice producers aide Under current law producers must plant at least pct their base acreage to be eligible pct their deficiency payments Most major U S farm groups lobbied hard against making any fundamental changes farm bill out fear full scale debate could expose agricultural problems to budget cutting pressures Representatives these farm groups they also fear efforts by Midwestern Democrats to force floor vote on bill require large acreage set asides return sharply higher support prices However Sen Tom Harkin D Iowa sponsor bill told Reuters he did intend to offer his measure as floor amendment but to bring through committee

reuters.unknown: Y RM f reute r f AM GULF AMERICAN

text.title: U S PREPARED TO ESCORT KUWAITI TANKERS
text.author: By CHARLES ALDINGER Reuters
text.body: The United States offered Navy warships to escort Kuwaiti oil tankers into out Gulf where they could be threatened by new Iranian anti ship missiles U S defense officials today We believe Kuwaitis also approached Soviet Union possibility using Soviet tankers to ship their oil one officials told Reuters But if there superpower protection we rather come us official officials who asked to be identified Kuwait asked possible protection dozen vessels most them oil tankers could be supplied by three U S Navy guided missile destroyers two guided missile frigates now southern part Gulf We told them we give them help we waiting to hear Kuwaiti response to our offer one official addition to half dozen ships U S Navy s small Mideast Task Force near Straits Hormuz Pentagon moved warships including Aircraft Carrier Kitty Hawk into northern Indian Ocean past month White House defense officials today massing fleet routine nothing to do Iran Iraq war or Iran s recent stationing Chinese made anti ship missiles near mouth Gulf land based missiles increased concern Kuwait other Middle East countries their oil shipments might be affected Several hundred vessels been confirmed hit Gulf by Iran Iraq since early White House spokesman Marlin Fitzwater told reporters today U S strategic interest to keep free flow oil gulf through Straits Hormuz But he U S ships region were on routine reuters.unknown: F f reute h f BC TECHNOLOGY

text.title: TECHNOLOGY ATT S T EFFORTS TO SELL COMPUTERS
text.author: By Catherine Arnst Reuters
text.body: American Telephone Telegraph Co another illustration maxim already learned by several other huge corporations success one segment electronics industry very difficult to translate into success selling computers ATT learning hard way all resources technological advances world can make up weak marketing sluggish responses to one most rapidly changing competitive industries Consequently ATT try again week to convince world serious computers after four years business by announcing set new products showcasing latest computer chief Vittorio Cassoni formerly ATT s Italian affiliate Ing C Olivetti Co Industry consultants ATT announce faster addition to B line minicomputers improved connectivity products new version Unix software operating system assortered peripheral equipment including laser printer announcements however hold minimal significance both ATT industry Forrester Research consultant John McCarthy They just never going to be significant player market as long as computers play subjagated role to telephone network he ATT world s largest company before breakup still pre eminent phone company United States only been able to carve out fractional share computer industry year particularly disastrous company s data systems division posted pre tax operating loss year billion dlrs ATT as whole reported profit after billion dlr charge against earnings down billion dlrs prior year Morale down throughout company after ATT reduced work force by people year leaving work force but analysts say situation computer division particularly bad especially since computer merged computer network sales forces Meanwhile company s most successful product personal computer ran out steam three months year after gaining some five pct market ATT seemed to lose their focus consultant Norman DeWitt president Dataquest Inc There were no major product enhancements year perception developed marketplace product tired Meanwhile to face increasingly aggressive competition smaller companies undercut ATT on price offered more technologically advanced machines I to say after fast start ATT just lost momentum on pc side DeWitt B line minicomputers never found great acceptance market ATT s Unix operating system though loved by scientists engineers yet to put serious dent much more widely used systems adopted by industry giant International Business Machines Corp IBM By fall ATT executives found themselves trying to defuse widespread speculation ATT going to abandon or sell off computer division company turned over all responsibility personal computers to Olivetti owns pct stake But analysts company s image dealt another blow week when ATT senior vice president James Edwards who preceded Cassoni as head computer division announced he leaving to become president TelWatch Inc small developer systems to manage networks Several other executives also left recent months including John Walsh head B minicomputer line although year old Cassoni considerable experience running Olivetti s successful computer operations analysts expressed concern his approach to ATT s business Cassoni he wants to acheive recognizable success both within ATT marketplace within two years widely assumed he rapidly abandon any product does meet those profitability goals problem such strategy analysts may give certain products enough time to become established customers may be reluctant to buy product could be discontinued year or two ATT chairman James Olson took slightly more conservative view computer division recently He lauded Cassoni s two year goal but he expects data systems division to turn around within five years Olson denied perception ATT retreating to womb going back to our old business long distance telephone systems at expense computer division
