text.title: IRAQ REPORTS ATTACKS ON SUPERTANKER OIL TARGETS
text.author: By MAAMOUN YOUSSEF Reuters
text.body: Iraq today warplnes attacked supertanker four Iranian oil sites vowed to keep up such raids until Gulf war ends surprise escalation attacks on oil installations broke more than month long lull Iraqi air force action also followed celebrations yesterday what Baghdad hailed as Iran s failure to achieve victory during Iranian year ended on Saturday high command communique warplanes hit western jetty at Iran s Kharg island oil terminal afternoon struck supertanker nearby at same time Kharg terminal attacked times since August raided January communique did identify supertanker but columns smoke were seen billowing London Lloyds insurance ton Iranian tanker Avaj hit on Saturday when Iraq reported earlier Gulf attack But there been no independent confirmation today s supertanker attack nor other raids on shipping reported by Baghdad past hours confirmed Iraqi attack took place on March eight when Iranian tanker Khark hit south Kharg Iraqi warplanes also struck Iran s offshore oilfields at Nowruz Cyrus Ardeshir northern gulf some km miles west Kharg island today s communique three oilfields been raided several times past three years Oil sources they were crucially important to Iran s oil export trade second high command communique today Iraqi warplanes flew sorties against Iranan targets positions at war front also reported clash between Iraqi naval units several Iranian boats carrying men to attack Iraqi oil terminal at northen tip Gulf Two Iranian boats wer destroyed sunk their occupants others fled

reuters.unknown: F f reute u f BC TALKING POINT WENDY S

text.title: TALKING POINT WENDY S INTERNATIONAL WEN
text.author: By Patti Domm Reuters
text.body: Takeover speculation buoyed Wendy s International Inc s stock even after Coca Cola Co took fizz out market rumors by denying interested suitor Wendy s retreated earlier high lost point when Coca Cola KO rumors were untrue However Wendy s remained up at on volume more than three shares Several analysts were skeptical rumors yet they they could conclude takeover fast food restaurant chain impossible Wendy s declined comment on takeover rumors all kinds Yet Wendy s spokesman company aware Business Week article named Coke as potential suitor market sources helped ignite rumor mill Market sources mentioned Anheuser Busch Inc BUD Pepsico Inc PEP as alternatives to Coke as acquirers Neither those companies comment nor Wendy s official It doesn t happen every day every week every month but unusual us to be linked those companies Denny Lynch Wendy s vice president communications However Lynch comment specifically on current market rumors Even before Coke denied rumors analysts been skeptical takeover since Atlanta based Coke stated views fast food chains as customers does want to become competitor to them I can t put another name on Kidder peabody analyst Jay Freedman as vaguer rumors continued to hold up Wendy s stock It very well could be someone s interested But Freedman he doesn t believe now right time Wendy s to be sold They re obviously having operational difficulties I ve always believed at right price Wendy s consider an offer but I can t believe right price at right time Freedman If transaction takes place buyer s going to control situation Freedman I just don t think there s anything going on I don t think s worth much more than where Joseph Doyle Smith Barney Analysts Wendy s suffered largely burger wars between itself McDonald s Corp MCD Pillsbury Co s PSY Burger King chain Wendy s third largest fast food hamburger chain U S lost pct same store sales year analysts Wendy s also fumbled when introduced high priced breakfast since withdrawn analysts Some analysts company should be bringing new products but too soon to predict significant turnaround There analysts however who believe Wendy s may be vulnerable to takeover James Murren C J Lawrence Wendy s could be worth to dlrs on break up basis He company improved debt to equity ratio Wendy s owns high percent own restaurants pct They also some attractive leaseholds on their restaurants Murren Murren despite downturn sales year Wendy s real sales store store turned upwards fourth quarter That first time seven quarters he Caroline Levy E F Hutton also believes something could be going on Wendy s My gut feeling something s going to happen I don t know what she She estimated takeover price be at least dlrs per share One analyst speculated Coke became rumored suitor because Wendy s decided to sell Coke at fountains instead Pepsi Wendy s currently embroiled litigation brought by Pepsi holds contract company analysts Pepsi s soda still sold Wendy s restaurants

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC GERMAN BANKING AUTHOR

text.title: GERMAN BANKING AUTHORITIES DRAWN INTO VW CASE
text.author: By Jonathan Lynn Reuters
text.body: West Germany s banking authorities being drawn into currency scandal surrounding Volkswagen AG VOWG F as repercussions allegations financial community widen banking sources Bundesbank seconded one currency experts to help state prosecutor investigating currency fraud at Volkswagen VW Brunswick Bundesbank spokesman Federal Banking Supervisory Office West Berlin also considering press allegations several banks parked open positions VW breaching banking regulations Earlier month Volkswagen incurred potential losses marks alleged fraud involving hedging open currency positions foreign exchange activities large non bank corporation normally attract attention West German banking regulators Their strict foreign exchange rules set up after Herstatt banking crash apply only to banks This strict banking supervision aims to protect special interests creditors depositors Bundesbank spokesman adding company shareholders were covered The Volkswagen case so far as involves Volkswagen s normal foreign exchange business lies far outside area Bundesbank he Bundesbank s decision to send currency expert to Brunswick to help investigations into activities involving Volkswagen s foreign exchange dealing room part normal assistance rendered by one public authority to another expert count as part state prosecutor s staff report back to Bundesbank he But Bundesbank could get more closely involved allegations banks used VW to circumvent regulations Section a Banking Law requires banks at close business each day to hold no more than pct their capital reserves open positions section introduced after Herstatt bank crash due to currency speculation Platow Brief financial newsletter on Friday banks mainly foreign been circumventing section a by parking such excess open positions VW mean bank concerned sell position temporarily to VW buying back day or so later However such repurchase agreements expressly included section a as still counting as open positions spokesman Federal Banking Supervisory Office West Berlin following allegations but investigations were difficult because banks been named He declined to say what steps were being taken But banking sources Supervisory Office as initial step approached Platow Brief identity banks but been refused Platow Brief declined comment If Supervisory Office ascertains banking regulations been infringed pursue case assistance Bundesbank Office subordinate to Finance Ministry does branches outside Berlin independent Bundesbank however operates branches West Germany closely monitoring local banks Banks deposit statistics including currency position data once month Bundesbank s regional administrations at federal state level Landeszentralbanken LZBs Currency dealers parking excess positions non banking corporates frequent practice Such positions often be sold tomorrow next delivery verbal agreement to buy back next day at same rate VW spokesman company policy to undertake currency hedging but he confirmed arbitrage allowed He declined to estimate volume currency arbitraging German press reports put at billion marks year spokesman declined to comment on how been possible to carry out fraud involving currency hedging given company s policy to conduct kind business VW finance director Rolf Selowsky accepted responsibility resigned VW suspended six other officials fired former foreign exchange chief Burkhard Bobby Junger Management board chief Carl Hahn told ceremony today marking VW s millionth vehicle personnel changes did mean any those involved guilty

reuters.unknown: RM A f reute r f BC uneasy calm as brazil

text.title: ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT BRAZIL DEBT DEADLINES LOOM
text.author: By Alan Wheatley Reuters
text.body: Slow progress talks between Brazil major foreign creditors increased likelihood U S banks declare their loans to Brazil non performing at end quarter bankers Several banks citing Brazil s suspension interest payments on billion dlrs billion dlr foreign debt absence coherent economic plan already they might take such step even though cost them tens millions dollars profits inconclusive meeting here March between central bank governor Francisco Gros Brazil s bank advisory committee can only stiffened resolve nasty row also looming over billion dlrs trade money market lines Brazil froze month legal commitment to maintain these credits runs out on March worried talk at Inter American Development Bank annual meeting here some disgruntled bank sue repayment raising specter cascade lawsuits tit for tat asset seizures My gut feeling common sense prevail But there risk Yes mood out there pretty nasty one New York banker commented Two or three years ago showdown between world s largest debtor largest creditors sent shock waves through financial markets But no longer Some U S money center bank stocks fell by pct immediate aftermath Brazil s payments halt But Eurodeposit markets bankers consider to be most sensitive gauge confidence there no discernible flight out bank instruments into safer government bonds fact system calmly withstood suspension part or full interest payments by countries owing billion dlrs region s total foreign debt billion Peru Ecuador Bolivia Costa Rica Honduras Guatemala Nicaragua all curtailed payments before Brazil explanation fairly relaxed view net new bank lending to Latin America dried up at same time as banks steadily bolstered their capital base As result exposure relative to capital fallen few now fear collapse major bank why banking analysts Citicorp CCI felt emboldened to state early day might put Brazil on cash basis even before interest becomes days overdue forfeit dlrs profits year as result but company earned over billion dlrs setback be manageable Some other banks as strong however protracted confrontation Brazil could still seriously erode depositor investor confidence especially if other debtors emboldened to follow suit press debt relief Bankers thus working hard to isolate Brazil Financing agreements were reached recently Chile Venezuela accord Philippines seems to be close at hand deal Argentina on new loans debt restructuring could be reached next two weeks bankers say taking hard line against wholesale debt relief banks clear backing Reagan Administration All us stake stability world banking system debt forgiveness plan damages commercial banks also weakens confidence world financial stability U S Treasury Secretary James Baker told IADB meeting Some European bankers however argue capitalization interest already happening practice banks ought to face up to fact work debtors on longer term solutions recognize all interest can be paid back right away Rigid accounting rules prevented U S banks seriously considering adding interest to principal loan because they to declare loan non performing But Brazilian central bank governor Gros if banks now volunteering to take step they might be more willing to discuss new ideas debt relief It s necessarily unfavorable development Gros when asked prospect Brazilian loans being put on cash basis We find more room to discuss these things innovations European banks already bitten bullet What clear however banks so angry frustrated Brazil they no mood to offer quick concessions long war attrition on debt front lies ahead

text.title: YEUTTER SEES GATT CONSENSUS ON FARM TRADE REFORM
text.author: By Graham Hillier Reuters
text.body: U S Trade Representative Clayton Yeutter trade ministers meeting here reached general consensus on agricultural trade reform under latest Uruguay round General Agreement on Tariffs Trade GATT Yeutter gave no precise details understanding but told journalists consensus covers principles involved agricultural trade reform what needs to be done to improve global situation agriculture Delegates countries meeting informally to discuss progress made since latest GATT round launched Punta del Este Uruguay September Yeutter at least people seem to be going down same road But how translates ultimately into negotiations another matter entirely There seems to be understanding need to deal problem quickly a more common understanding how we going to get here to there Yeutter However hard work still to come couple years tough negotiations ahead he It ludicrous nations world to plough immense amounts financial resources into production items nobody wants to buy he He long term answer to switch some financial resources now committed to agriculture to other more productive areas help agriculture because some inefficient non productive segments stop operating he Individual segments many countries may lose process but should result more rational system world wide production within or years he important agriculture negotiations reach relatively early conclusion because U S spending billion dlrs year European Community probably more than ineffective use financial resources he Asked prospect priority agriculture negotiations he one to be politically realistic If there any chance getting agricultural trade reform done two to three years s going to to be as part larger package

text.title: TAIWAN COMPLAINS ABOUT SIZE OF RESERVES

text.body: Taiwan s foreign exchange reserves swollen by strong trade surpluses to record billion U S Dlrs becoming problem government officials Official figures show latest level compares previous record billion dlrs on March billion late March Central bank Governor Chang Chi cheng told reporters increase reserves result heavy intervention by bank on local interbank market bought nearly two billion U S Dlrs between March he Wang Chao ming vice chairman government s Council Economic Planning Development told Reuters rising reserves were a big headache Taiwan He government expects heavier pressure U S Where protectionist bills being proposed against nations such as Taiwan Japan large trade surpluses U S Wang government launch new measures within next two months to further reduce import tariffs open market wider to foreign products especially those U S Wang measures aim at helping reduce Taiwan s trade surplus rose to billion U S Dlrs first two months billion year earlier Nearly pct surplus U S Vice Economic Minister Wang Chien shien agreed Wang s remarks efforts to avert U S Protectionism were running out time We must do quickly or face retaliation Washington he He measures include removal trade barriers on insurance inland services U S Companies Chang Chi cheng central bank could stop buying U S Dollars because heavy sales by local exporters who fear strong local dollar cause them exchange losses He bank studying revision foreign exchange rules hope further reducing currency controls but declined to give details Taiwan dollar risen pct against U S Dollar since September opened at to U S Dollar today expected to rise further to June to by end year some foreign bankers

reuters.unknown: F f reute u f BC AUSTRALIAN MINISTER S

text.title: AUSTRALIAN MINISTER SEES TARGETED OIL TAX STRATEGY
text.body: Australia s crude oil tax strategy probably best tackled terms targeted rather than broadly based approach Federal Resources Energy Minister Gareth Evans told meeting here He told Australian Petroleum Exploration Association APEA annual conference there prospect developing package recognise government s economic priorities while also meeting some industry s concerns Evans referring to nearly completed government review oil taxation Evans there were plenty examples where targeted approaches to oil industry taxation produced good results recent years These include reduction top marginal crude excise rate on old Bass Strait oil found before September to pct pct waiver excise on onshore oil announced September he industry through APEA been calling elimination secondary taxation on oil order to boost incentives prospecting against background weak prices Australia s relatively low exploration levels While nobody wants to add further unnecessary complexity to already complex taxation regime I am inclined to favour these kinds tailored approaches ahead sweeping changes leave government revenue much reduced may still leave lot uncertainty as to what individual companies going to do major areas Evans He government did intend to change resource rent taxation RRT legislation now before parliament response to industry calls to allow all exploration expenditure given area to be deductible As previously reported RRT tax pct limited to highly prospective offshore areas based on profits after certain rate return been achieved individual projects APEA true profit based tax because exploration deductibility limited to successful projects Evans decision to change RRT based more than anything on government s desire to ensure certainty stability new regime adding major investments already been planned on existing ground rules

text.title: DOUBTS ABOUT ACCORD SEEN WEAKENING DOLLAR FURTHER
text.author: By Kunio Inoue Reuters
text.body: The dollar expected to decline further coming days as scepticism mounts effectiveness month s Paris accord to stabilise currency exchange rates senior foreign exchange dealers Following fall today to record yen dealers they expect dollar to establish new trading range to yen before market again tries to push down Behind latest dollar fall lies belief month s accord no longer enough to stop operators pushing dollar down dealers The recent remark by U S Treasury Secretary James Baker Paris accord did set any target ranges major currencies cast shadow on agreement Koji Kidokoro general manager Mitsui Bank Ltd s treasury division He market interpreted as indicating U S favour weaker dollar little intention intervening to support currency This eliminated widespread market caution against possible joint central bank intervention Kidokoro Dealers dollar gathered renewed downward momentum Bank Japan intervention alone could hardly contain further slide currency They central bank bought between one to billion dlrs today including direct purchases through brokers yesterday might bought small amount dollars through U S Central bank New York Most dealers they doubted U S Federal Reserve intervene on own account to support dollar but some might occur if dollar fell much below yen If dollar drops to low level could reduce flow foreign capital into U S Securities Americans don t want Haruya Uehara chief money market manager Mitsubishi Trust Banking Corp He dollar may return to around yen next month when corporations reduce their dollar sales after they close their books business year ending on March But dealers longer term outlook dollar remained bearish due to lacklustre performance U S Economy continuing U S Trade deficit Japanese delays announcing text.title: CHINA EXPECTED TO SHOW BIG BUDGET DEFICIT
text.author: By Mark O Neill Reuters
text.body: China s Finance Minister Wang Bingqian report budget deficit up to nine billion yuan prescribe austerity measures budget speech on Thursday foreign bankers diplomats told Reuters Chinese officials deficit several billion after surplus billion followed six years deficits including record billion yuan shortfall They given exact figure officials blamed deficit on excessive investment fixed assets consumer demand drop efficiency state firms trade deficit lower income import duties China needs nationwide campaign to increase production while cutting expenditure official Peking Review editorial yesterday China should institute means effective control macro economy invigoration enterprises larger ones particular by emphasising quality efficiency reduced consumption Only by such measures magazine can overall supply demand balance society be secured economy develop steadily over long period Western diplomat major factors deficit he estimated at up to nine billion yuan were drop efficiency wage rises state firms whose profits taxes account substantial part national revenue State Statistical Bureau SSB month profits taxes state firms fell pct to billion yuan while production costs were over budget losses rose product quality unstable SSB profits most state firms fell because bad management rapid changes external conditions For some materials state firms to compete on free market where prices up to double those materials they buy under fixed quota state diplomat The firms subject to proper market discipline because they cannot go bankrupt do to repay bank loans to employ workers whether or they need them Under these conditions they cannot properly adjust to economic levers state introducing he Another diplomat Wang s major problem excess demand economy caused by wage increases well ahead industrial growth excess growth capital construction He must dampen growth through raising taxes or cutting government expenditure he China s economy inherently unstable either high or trough He Wang reaffirm themes repeated by leaders since start year thrift improved efficiency cutting investment outside state plan reducing consumption to bring demand supply into balance There be no surprises diplomat first diplomat one sign thrifty times lack banquet during visit he made to major Chinese industrial city Normally foreign guest s visit chance boys to feast on Mao Tai a strong liquor turtle sea slugs one banquet given by them one given return by me But there none on visit he He added economic reforms slow year particular price changes issuing shares raise sensitive issues ownership ideology Bond issues raise no such dilemmas continue he added North American banker who estimated deficit at eight billion yuan economic policy been affected by national drive against bourgeois liberalism phrase meaning Western political ideas In China political system dictates economic policy he The large deficit gives conservatives stick to beat reformers demand more economic austerity One China s top economic policy makers told me week be year consolidation his firm less overseas investment lower imports new funding to be sourced internally banker he more comfortable China s stability now than two months ago when drive launched after resignation Communist Party chief Hu Yaobang There no leftist alternative to reforms he There no going back to policy strict central control But reforms take years What you now confused mix control market economies

text.body: Prime Minister Yasuhiro Nakasone intervened to try to resolve Japan s escalating dispute U S Over semiconductor trade government officials At today s Cabinet meeting Nakasone told Trade Industry Minister Hajime Tamura to redouble his efforts to calm U S Anger over what sees as Japan s unfair trade practices semiconductors Nakasone intervened only two days before scheduled meeting Reagan administration s Economic Policy Council to consider whether Japan reneging on microchip pact U S pact agreed year after months negotiations calls on Japan to stop selling cut price chips world markets to raise imports U S Semiconductors Senior U S Officials accused Tokyo failing to live up to accord threatened retaliatory action Yesterday Tamura s Ministry International Trade Industry MITI launched ditch attempt to salvage pact by writing letters to U S Policy makers setting out Japan s case telling Japanese chip makers to cut output his letter contents were released today Tamura MITI survey carried out at beginning March showed Japanese producers were selling at cut rate prices Asian markets separate letter sent to senior U S Officials MITI vice minister international affairs Makoto Kuroda suggested two countries could conduct joint investigation into allegations Japanese chip dumping such markets

text.title: DOUBTS ABOUT ACCORD SEEN WEAKENING DOLLAR FURTHER
text.author: By Kunio Inoue Reuters
text.body: The dollar expected to decline further coming days as scepticism mounts effectiveness month s Paris accord to stabilise currency exchange rates senior foreign exchange dealers Following fall today to record yen dealers they expect dollar to establish new trading range to yen before market again tries to push down Behind latest dollar fall lies belief month s accord no longer enough to stop operators pushing dollar down dealers The recent remark by U S Treasury Secretary James Baker Paris accord did set any target ranges major currencies cast shadow on agreement Koji Kidokoro general manager Mitsui Bank Ltd s treasury division He market interpreted as indicating U S favour weaker dollar little intention intervening to support currency This eliminated widespread market caution against possible joint central bank intervention Kidokoro Dealers dollar gathered renewed downward momentum Bank Japan intervention alone could hardly contain further slide currency They central bank bought between one to billion dlrs today including direct purchases through brokers yesterday might bought small amount dollars through U S Central bank New York Most dealers they doubted U S Federal Reserve intervene on own account to support dollar but some might occur if dollar fell much below yen If dollar drops to low level could reduce flow foreign capital into U S Securities Americans don t want Haruya Uehara chief money market manager Mitsubishi Trust Banking Corp He dollar may return to around yen next month when corporations reduce their dollar sales after they close their books business year ending on March But dealers longer term outlook dollar remained bearish due to lacklustre performance U S Economy continuing U S Trade deficit Japanese delays announcing economic stimulation package The Americans getting frustrated at Japan s inertia stimulating economy Hirozumi Tanaka assistant general manager Dai Ichi Kangyo Bank Ltd s international treasury division Paris currency accord Japan promised package economic measures after fiscal budget passed to boost domestic demand increase imports thus reduce trade surplus package expected April but debate on budget been delayed by opposition boycott parliamentary business over proposed introduction sales tax circumstances government only slim chance producing meaningful economic package near future Dai Ichi Kangyo s Tanaka Dealers if steps taken to stimulate Japanese economy protectionist sentiment U S Congress grow put more downward pressure on dollar

reuters.unknown: E F f reute r f BC CANADA OUTLINES GATT

text.title: CANADA OUTLINES GATT AGRICULTURAL REFORM PLAN
text.body: Canadian Trade Minister Pat Carney agricultural policies should hurt world international trade should therefore become more price responsive over time She told delegates at informal meeting trade ministers one five principles Canada wanted adopted reforming agriculture General Agreement on Tariffs Trade GATT Secondly support agriculture should avoid production incentives thirdly countries should freeze seek to reduce government aid measures distorted world prices Carney Carney fourth principle countries should introduce new import barriers mandated by existing legislation fifth these basic principles must be implemented collectively Carney later told Reuters Canadian guidelines basically compatible seven point Australian proposals announced Davos Switzerland January European trade sources conference welcomed Canadian initiative but some delegates only European Community voiced reservations some principles Carney there lot political among ministers here to complete Uruguay Round GATT under four years there also realisation to be done balanced way The consensus view to proceed as fast as we can on broad front see what areas emerge where we can get early conclusion she However meeting did identify what those areas Carney She Canada U S Bilateral trade negotiations must be concluded at least draft form by October progressing well

reuters.unknown: RM V A f reute r f BC U S ECONOMY SHOWS P

text.title: U S ECONOMY SHOWS PROMISING SIGNS OF GROWTH
text.author: By Donna Smith Reuters
text.body: The U S economy showing some promising signs accelerated expansion despite sluggishness fourth quarter year private economists say Some slowness experienced October December period been expected to spill over into first quarter year as tax law changes went into effect January slowed business consumer spending But some latest economic data show signs surprising strength U S economy although some economists remain cautious outlook Commerce Department reported today new orders durable goods February jumped by billion dlrs six pct rise to billion dlrs Even excluding volatile defense goods durable goods orders rose healthy pct agency February numbers surpassed expectations many financial analysts whose predictions ranged flat to increases up to five pct January February employment statistics suggest Gross National Product show healthy rate growth first three months year Lyle Gramley economist Mortgage Bankers Association U S jobless rate February January pct lowest rate since March number new non farm jobs rose by February after gain January December increase government employment data suggests GNP annual growth rate three to pct first quarter Gramley Much be attributed to businesses rebuilding their inventories likely to be sustained second quarter Gramley He expects slowdown second quarter smaller increases personal consumption government spending He also sees residential construction declining mostly multi family housing units Fidelity Bank senior economist Mickey Levy some fourth quarter slowness continue Levy predicts GNP grow at scant pct rate first quarter accelerate during second quarter show brisk pct annual rate third quarter key to both forecasts marked improvement U S trade balance expected because decline dollar s value over year half The improvement be gradual long lasting Levy predicted Most be through import reduction but at least one third be due to rise product exports as prices U S goods become more attractive overseas Reagan administration predicted trade deficit soared to record levels year improve year U S economy grow by respectable pct year compared pct rate year As part effort to reduce trade deficit U S been pressing West Germany Japan to stimulate their domestic demand goods U S others U S officials believe help take some pressure off United States whose five years economic growth been mainstay developing countries U S economy provided them giant market their goods giving them way to earn income badly needed to service their foreign debt government week U S economy grew at modest pct annual rate during fourth quarter There were indications improvement huge imbalance between volume goods imported to United States those shipped abroad report showed rising volume exports corresponding to decline imports despite fact current dollar terms U S trade deficit worsened during closing three months While fourth quarter economic growth weak corporate profits jumped healthy pct during period government also reported inflation as measured by GNP price deflator remained check growing moderate pct period lowest rise years government also reported consumer spending key element five year economic recovery jumped pct February after falling two pct January Federal Reserve Board also reported manufacturing sector been one weaker elements U S economy showing signs recovery latest report on current economic conditions Fed economic activity various regions country ranged uneven or steady to improving Manufacturing activity showed signs improvement most regions except Dallas where orders remained sluggish Chase Econometrics Chairman Lawrence Chimerine pick up U S manufacturing sector largely due to drop dollar s value He he does foresee major pick up economic activity but does believe economy slip into recession either He higher prices on imported products wage cuts helped manufacturing sector squeeze consumers purchasing power That pattern starting continue number years Chimerine He sees economic growth hovering around modest two pct level next few years

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC PHILIPPINE CENTRAL BA

text.title: PHILIPPINE CENTRAL BANKER FACES CORRUPTION CHARGES
text.author: By Chaitanya Kalbag Reuters
text.body: A government appointed special prosecutor ordered filing corruption charges over closure private bank against Philippine central bank governor Jose Fernandez who he contest charges Ombudsman Raul Gonzalez told Reuters there evidence to indicate Fernandez misused his office ordering closure Pacific Banking Corp July He charges against Fernandez be filed within week special court corruption cases adding defendant could appeal against ruling Supreme Court Fernandez New York talks Philippines creditor banks on rescheduling billion dlrs country s foreign debt central bank statement quoted Fernandez as saying Pacific Bank s closure sale were accordance law Fernandez some points may been missed appreciation case reason he be filing motion reconsideration Ombudsman s resolution statement Central bank sources statement drafted after Fernandez senior deputy governor Gabriel Singson who Manila conferred on telephone Gonzalez his office ordered charges filed after hearing submissions by Fernandez plaintiff Paula Paug president Pacific Bank s Employees Union her complaint Paug Fernandez acted arbitrarily ordering closure Pacific Bank placing under receivership without giving bank right to appeal throwing hundreds employees out work Paug also Fernandez withdrawn his stockholding Far East Bank Trust Company took over Pacific Bank s assets when he became central bank governor January Fernandez founded Far East She alleged Fernandez misused his position by appointing two Far East bank executives to central bank consultancies giving them access to Pacific Bank records She also disputed Fernandez interpretation Pacific s accounts January to May claiming bank made profit loss central bank statement quoted Fernandez as stressing Pacific Bank repeatedly given notice continuing losses bank immediate need putting up additional capital to eliminate insolvency central bank tried to assist bid by Bank Hawaii Philippine sugar trader Antonio Chan to purchase Pacific Bank but negotiations collapsed because certain legal impediments statement central bank invited several banks to submit offers Pacific sale to Far East approved by Monetary Board by Fernandez alone Fernandez also quoted statement as saying he divested himself all interests Far East Bank when he became central bank governor Far East Bank spokesman declined comment on charges against Fernandez footnote to page resolution recommending prosecution against Fernandez Gonzalez prima facie evidence misuse power also existed against all then members country s Monetary Board as well as Far East executives ordered their investigation He Fernandez s action fitted political climate during former President Ferdinand Marcos s final years The prevailing mood day those high offices either to imitate penchant then President Marcos his wife to run roughshod over human rights citizens Or to follow blindly or canine devotion any instructions above Gonzalez wrote Gonzalez named to his post months ago his office received more than complaints misuse power He among those facing prosecution were five provincial governors appointed by President Corazon Aquino

reuters.unknown: RM f reute r f BC SUDAN REJECTS IMF DEM

text.title: SUDAN REJECTS IMF DEMAND FOR DEVALUATION
text.body: Sudan rejected demand by International Monetary Fund currency devaluation because such move negative impact on economy official Sudan News Agency SUNA reported Finance Minister Beshir Omer quoted by SUNA his government also rejected IMF demand to lift state subsidies on basic consumer goods SUNA monitored by British Broadcasting Corporation Omer made remarks after meeting Khartoum yesterday IMF envoy Abdel Shakour Shaalan Sudan burdened by foreign debt billion dlrs some dlrs arrears to IMF declared ineligible fresh loans February year February Sudan announced pct devaluation pound against dollar adjusting official exchange rate to pounds to U S Currency Since then resisted pressure main creditors more currency adjustments arguing past devaluations failed to boost exports but raised local consumer prices Sudan also incentive rate four pounds to dollar foreign visitors remittances by expatriate workers Dealers Khartoum s thriving black market dollar sold at pounds today stringent import regulations government increasingly short foreign currency black market dollars used to finance smuggled imports neighbouring countries mainly Egypt Kenya Ethiopia Zaire Western diplomats Khartoum say meetings between IMF Sudanese government officials do amount to formal talks but rather effort by IMF to monitor Sudan s economic performance diplomats Sudan hoped planned four year economic recovery program be acceptable to IMF as serious attempt to tackle country s economic troubles persuade Gulf Arab creditors to pay IMF arrears they could provide Sudan clean bill health IMF could take to Western government creditors grouped informally so called Paris Club to reschedule debt payments Twenty three pct Sudan s total foreign debt owed to members Paris Club diplomats Sudan s Finance Minister month country s IMF representative told him fund s executive board very pleased dlrs arrears we paid past couple months representative Omer IMF Managing Director Michel Camdessus he ask Saudi Arabia to Sudan owes billion dlrs to help Khartoum to pay more Sudan annual debt liability nearly dlrs but set aside only some dlrs to service debts fiscal year ending next June

text.title: FED GOVERNOR SUPPORTS COMMODITY PRICE GUIDE
text.body: Robert Heller member Board Governors Federal Reserve System commodity prices could form useful guide setting domestic international monetary policy Speaking to conservative Heritage Foundation Heller A broadly based commodity price index may be worth exploring as guide to monetary policy In times rising commodity prices monetary policy might be tightened times falling commodity prices monetary policy might be eased he Commodities also standardized to avoid measurement problems occur at beginning production so as to give early warning signs wholesale retail changes There no need to react to every small fluctuation commodity prices or to do so on daily basis Heller prepared text But if commodity prices exhibit broad trend policy action might be considered he Heller using broad based commodity price index as indicator monetary policy also contribute to stabilized currency exchange rates Commodity prices generally uniform worldwide prices them more consistent than other types goods he He other beneficial effects be to stabilize export commodity prices developing countries by using commodity basket as guidepost monetary policy

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC STERLING OUTLOOK CLOU

text.title: STERLING OUTLOOK CLOUDED BY TEST OF PARIS ACCORD
text.author: By Myra MacDonald Reuters
text.body: The move by foreign exchange markets to test strength Paris currency accord thrown into question near term outlook sterling until recently one main beneficiaries agreement analysts Since six nation accord month sterling risen sharply adding almost five pct on trade weighted index While accord effectively stifled dollar yen dollar mark movements markets turned their attention to sterling as foreign investors rushed to take advantage relatively high U K Interest rates But analysts say pound been sidelined by first tentative test Paris accord seen yesterday market now looks set sooner or later to push dollar down further test willingness central banks to intervene Analysts say if banks do intervene effectively Paris accord could collapse On balance sterling be net sufferer if G collapses Phillips Drew analyst Stephen Lewis He sterling lose out as markets turned their attention to capital movements whereas previously they been restricted to looking only at interest yield on currencies However although most analysts foreign exchange dealers were forecasting brief period consolidation or even retracement sterling none were expecting very sharp drop U K Currency Sterling remained supported by optimism on U K Political economic outlook firmer oil prices relatively high interest rates they Bullish sentiment on U K Economic outlook been running especially high after week s budget seen as popular both markets British voters Sterling also supported by signs weakening West German Japanese economies where growth trailing behind three pct forecast U K Recent opinion polls showing Britain s ruling conservative party ahead opposition parties popularity also supported pound addition sterling so far shrugged off two half point cuts U K Bank base lending rates less than two weeks further half point cut widely expected next week or so already been largely discounted U K Base rates now running at pct still relatively high compared to other western countries analysts further base rate cut to pct unlikely to affect sterling Sterling today appeared resilient to dollar s decline dropping only slightly on cross rate basis Worries renewed turbulence foreign exchange markets however were reflected U K Government bond gilt market where prices dropped by up to point Until now foreign investor interest gilt market been one major reasons behind rise sterling Dealers they expected pound to hold quietly steady next few days while market awaits further developments on dollar Thursday s U K Current account figures February Market forecasts deficit around stg after January s small surplus

text.body: The president Export Import Bank Bank changing lending policies to reflect changing conditions export financing President John Bohn told House Appropriations subcommittee hearing commercial banks largely withdrawn financing exports export projects were becoming smaller Exporters now need financing riskier markets on deals smaller take longer to put together close Bohn his testimony Lenders however want less risk higher profit transaction oriented less labor intensive activities It became clear to us EXimbank must assume broader range explicitly defined country transaction risks than previously Programs procedures need to be simplified streamlined internally consistent he Bohn Bank focus on needs middle market product or service exporter essentially one loan program one guarantee program both medium term long term export transactions Both programs provide up to pct financing maximum permitted under OECD consensus Eximbank loans carry minimum interest rate allowed by OECD rate schedule market term he Bohn Bank requesting limitation billion dlrs regular loan obligations up to dlrs may be available as tied aid credits limitation billion dlrs guarantee insurance commitments He Bank to come back to Congress later year to discuss capitalization needs

text.body: South Africa repay pct frozen billion dollar debt to foreign creditors over next three years under agreement reached today London Finance Minister Barend du Plessis He South Africa already repaid five pct debt under standstill agreement expiring on June These arrangements confirm South Africa s continued willingness to maintain good relations foreign creditors to meet foreign commitments orderly way du Plessis told news conference Du Plessis new interim debt agreement substantially continuation arrangement ending June calls South Africa to continue paying all interest on total foreign debt billion dlrs new debt standstill extend July to June three pct down payment permitted on July provided such debt already reached maturity du Plessis Finance Minister Barend du Plessis told new conference banks holding more than pct frozen debt agreed to new arrangement worked out South African negotiators London other creditor banks also expected to approve agreement he Reserve Bank governor Gerhard de Kock agreement good deal both South Africa banks added three year length agreement enormous significance to South Africa Reserve Bank governor Gerhard de Kock agreement good deal both South Africa banks Besides billion dlr frozen debt South Africa also owes ten billion dlrs debt includes significant amount medium term liabilities continue to be repaid on normal maturity dates pct to be repaid under standstill amounts to billion dollars total five pct or dlrs be repaid second half pct or dlrs calendar three pct or dlrs calendar pct or dlrs first half Du Plessis banks holding more than pct frozen debt agreed to new arrangement worked out South African negotiators London other creditor banks also expected to approve agreement he De Kock speaking at same news conference three year length agreement enormous significance to South Africa De Kock South Africa negotiated position basic economic financial strength We were never overborrowed to begin we now underborrowed by all international criteria I ve ever heard he Du Plessis available foreign reserves Reserve Bank increased by dlrs past two months continued current account surplus will be sufficient to meet terms new interim debt agreement Du Plessis banks were showing much more confidence South African economy country as whole He attributed to restoration law order greatly reduced only extent unrest but also intensity unrest South Africa been under state emergency since June because black political violence claimed over lives past three years Du Plessis no political demands were made by banks South Africa now rapidly returning to very good relations foreign creditors He there were encouraging signs some foreign investors were again taking more realistic view South Africa Recent examples were rise financial rand sharp increase foreign exchange reserves billion dlr frozen debt billion dlrs owed by public sector billion dlrs by private industry du Plessis remaining billion dlrs consisted seven billion dlrs owed by government agencies three billion dlrs by private sector

reuters.unknown: C G f reute u f BC ILLINOIS CO OP FUTURE

text.title: ILLINOIS CO OP FUTURES DISSOLUTION VOTE SET
text.author: By Keith Leighty
text.body: The shareholders Illinois Cooperative Futures Co futures trading arm many Midwest farm cooperatives more than years vote Wednesday on possible dissolution directors company called special meeting recommended dissolution month citing falling volume increasing costs Sources close to organization told Reuters pullout Growmark Inc holds more than pct capital stock led to call dissolution possible demise cooperative set clearing houses scrambling trading business regional local cooperatives comprise membership Ironically Growmark at time regional farm cooperative major river terminal elevators founded Illinois Cooperative Futures on December But Growmark became affiliated year Archer Daniels Midland Decatur Ill markets grain through joint subsidiary two companies ADM Growmark relationship Growmark no longer needs to trade futures through cooperative Tom Mulligan president co op Membership company Mulligan termed cooperative cooperatives declined notable loss AgriIndustries Iowa became affiliated Cargill Inc Illinois Co op s other members include such regional cooperatives as Indiana Grain based Indianapolis Goldkist Atlanta Ga Midstates Toledo Ohio Farmland Industries Kansas City Mo Farmers Commodities Des Moines Harvest States Minneapolis Some observors demise Illinois Cooperative Futures Co serious blow to cooperative system Instead banding together individual cooperatives forced to go their own ways floor manager one cash house at Chicago Board Trade Such move destroy cohesiveness gives farm cooperatives advantage market at time few major commercial companies growing dominant he Don Hanes vice president communications National Council Farm Cooperatives cooperatives exist today down five years ago The period we ve gone through past five years been quite crunch he There s been lot consolidation marketing co ops One problem he co ops sell grain to major commercials export rather than exporting themselves losing potential profits But exporting grain requires heavy investments multi million dollar loss posted six years ago by Farmers Export Co co op set up to export grains served to make folks gun shy Hanes Mulligan he believes dissolution if approved result change futures industry rather than change U S agricultural economics grain dealer at one member co op futures arm was convenience something saved us little bit money Its dissolution force us to change our way doing business We re sorry to see co op go by wayside he But there lot people out there to do business There plenty capable firms Steven W Cavanaugh vice president grain marketing Indiana Grain he prefer to trade futures through Chicago based cooperative In terms clearing our business as unit as opposed to individuals there be economic savings he but added The times change changing times come different opinions what businesses ought to be around Cavanaugh possible demise futures arm nothing to do profitability I guarantee you company trouble sound healthy organization year ended February Illinois Cooperative reported income dlrs members equity or net worth dlrs annual report most recent year been filed Under cooperative system income operations returned as patronage refunds to members Income refunds past five years been declining year ended February co op reported income dlrs patronage refunds dlrs Patronage refunds year ended February totalled dlrs You re dealing substantially lower volume Mulligan Lower volume translates into higher costs According to company s annual report Growmark owns pct preferred shares four pct common shares Illinois Cooperative Futures Co Mulligan declined to speculate on how much capital Growmark entitled to He he could determine figure unless shareholders decide favor dissolution Equity distributed according to each member s trading volume as result changes year to year However Mulligan company could continue to meet minimum capital requirements to trade futures even if Growmark pulled out

text.title: CONRAC CAX SOARS FOLLOWING MARK IV IV BID
text.author: By Cal Mankowski Reutersd
text.body: Heavy buying by speculators boosted Conrac Corp to higher than dlr per share cash tender offer announced by Mark IV Industries Inc IV It s case ChemLawn euphoria one arbitrageur referring to recent hostile tender began at dlrs per share ended when ChemLawn Corp CHEM found white knight willing to bid dlrs Conrac arbitrageur dlrs per share seemed like appropriate price Another it s too early to project outcome The market speaking itself saying dlr offer inadequate second arbitrageur But he added hard to make case Conrac being worth much more than dlrs where shares traded today He noted stock recently sold high teens there could be downward risk dlrs or more if Conrac able to thwart Mark IV Conrac urged shareholders to take no action while board studies offer confers advisers Conrac make recommendation by April third arbitrageur noted Mark IV been involved several takeovers previously proven itself to be determined bidder They re beginners he Another Conrac might trouble if tried to find another buyer It s hodge podge non related businesses he There only small universe people who want to own company as s presently structured Conrac involved video displays computer software aircraft instruments telephone answering machines welding equipment other products I m telling retail clients to sell leave rest those who can take risk Rudolph Hokanson analyst at Milwaukee Co He called dlr offer by Mark IV fair value but on low side I don t think management looking buyer any way before offer he Hokanson Conrac conservative finances developed reputation quality products serve niche markets He management done good job turning around telephone answering machine business

reuters.unknown: C T f reute u f BC COCOA COUNCIL MOVES C

text.title: COCOA BUFFER STOCK ACCORD CLOSER DELEGATES SAY
text.author: By Lisa Vaughan Reuters
text.body: The International Cocoa Organization ICCO moved closer to agreement on buffer stock rules many delegates saying they expect to reach accord by Friday Everyone convinced buffer stock rules should be place by Friday so buffer stock can be put into operation Monday consumer delegate The atmosphere excellent Other delegates buffer stock might be operational by Monday but could be place by around April if rules agreed by Friday detailed package on how buffer stock manager buy sell cocoa presented to buffer stock working group afternoon big step toward very interesting stage negotiations delegates package based on negotiating principles informally agreed by delegates been forged bit by bit during fortnight long meetings by ICCO Executive Director Kobena Erbynn small group other delegates Producers European Community EC consumers scheduled to consider paper separately then jointly tomorrow Under proposal buffer stock manager buy cocoa origins or second hand market on offer system He alert market via news agencies as to when he wanted to buy cocoa include shipment details tonnage desired delegates manager buy cocoa on competitive basis rather than choosing cheapest cocoa as before giving preference to ICCO member country exporters Standard price differentials be fixed each origin similar to golf handicaps to determine relative competitiveness offers various cocoas different origins they differentials could be reviewed at request member country or recommendation buffer stock manager delegates Revision be decided by majority vote ICCO council Buffer stock purchases non ICCO member countries be allowed to exceed pct total buffer stock they purchases be limited to tonnes cocoa per day tonnes per week could be bought nearby intermediate forward positions they added One underlying ideas rules package transparency meaning virtually all buffer stock manager s market activities be public he as little discretion as possible delegates After tin market collapse when International Tin Council buffer stock ran out funds cocoa delegates anxious to install safeguards cocoa market mechanism they Earnest debate on buffer stock proposal expected to begin late tomorrow as delegations feel pressure approaching Friday deadline when ICCO meeting due to adjourn delegates ICCO failed to agree buffer stock rules January when new International Cocoa Agreement came into force existing buffer stock tonnes cocoa frozen place bank balance dlrs both untouchable until rules agreed Though current semi annual council meeting chance delegates to cement buffer stock rules producers keen to get wheels market stabilizing mechanism turning to stem decline world prices delegates

text.body: There good chance United States Latin America agree reforms Inter American Development Bank IADB as result talks yesterday U S Treasury Secretary James Baker Mexican Finance Minister Gustavo Petricioli This complex issue but I am very optimistic on agreement he told reporters during IADB s annual meeting here U S holds pct stake Bank proposed lowering veto power to pct move strongly opposed by Latin countries together hold pct Petricioli he saw basis compromise when issue comes up again during International Monetary Fund World Bank interim meetings next month Washington He Baker indicated receptivity to Latin America s position during talks yesterday so called A countries Brazil Argentina Mexico who stand to suffer net deficit IADB funding unless Bank votes substantial capital increase Proposals on table seventh replenishment funds totalling billion dlrs period plus billion carried over sixth replenishment But Washington previously agree to nine billion dlr increase subscription unless reforms were agreed position described today by Nicaragua s Central Bank governor Joaquin Cuadra Chamorro as undemocratic Petricioli nevertheless Baker showed flexibility being prepared to accommodate different proposals promised to look into alternatives He alternative now being looked at new procedures delaying IADB loan approval to satisfy U S concern lending currently too lax rather than change basic voting structure There accordingly be two step procedure whereby need just pct vote to delay loan approval year after second review require pct blocking vote Any change basic voting structure require change IADB s charter turn lengthy process prior approval by Congresses each country Petricioli common Venezuela he expressed reservations on conditions might be placed as result Washington s proposals increased IADB sectoral lending but welcomed bigger role Bank U S debt strategy

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC NEW S AFRICA ACCORD W

text.title: NEW S AFRICA ACCORD WITH BANKS BROUGHT COMPROMISE
text.author: By Marguerite Nugent Reuters
text.body: A new agreement covering repayment part South Africa s foreign debt represents compromise between country commercial bank creditors following several weeks intense difficult negotiations senior banking sources Pretoria Reserve Bank Governor Gerhard De Kock termed agreement good deal both South Africa banks But as one senior banker noted It probably best we could hope We the banks wanted more money they the South Africans didn t want to pay new agreement extend three years standstill arrangement been place since August due to expire on June Depending on maturity various debts banks receive on July repayments representing three pct arrears overdue debt covered by standstill also require repayment over life standstill another pct overdue debt spread over six month invervals depending on maturity various debts total slightly more than billion dlrs year South Africa repaid dlrs out billion dlrs covered by standstill At time bankers argued unsuccessfully larger repayment given country s trade surplus billion dlrs Bankers hoped time they could secure even larger repayment around one billion dlrs Although there been speculation standstill be extended three years many did believe long term pact be acceptable to U S banks Those banks taken hard line negotiations because America s strong anti apartheid policies agreement reached today differs very little one reached little over year ago However does include one moderation option contained pact introduces yet another catchphrase into jargon reschedulings new agreement contains exit vehicle under banks can convert their debt into year loans Under previous agreement banks were only given options three year loans While option may be unpalatable to U S banks could offer others potential repayment slightly more than half their investment over next seven years To convert debts bank to find borrower looking loan year maturity then negotiate individually interest rates to be charged loans represent any new money as loan be obligation new borrower there be repayment stream could give bank as much as pct face value by year seven one banker Bankers suggested depending on banks political economic forecasts South Africa if decided to take option may much difficulty finding such borrowers They noted South Africa s Public Investment Commission active borrower area market Today s agreement reached between South Africa s chief debt negotiator Chris Stals who chairs Standstill Coordinating Commmittee representatives banks on commercial bank technical committee bankers telexes be sent today to country s other bank creditors documentation covering proposal be mailed out shortly Because banks sensitivity to South Africa s apartheid regime previous negotiations were conducted Fritz Leutwiler former head Swiss National Bank acting as mediator Leutwiler involved these talks involved himself negotiations since year bankers time banks sent their responses on proposal to Leutwiler who turn notified South Africans time procedure be less structured be up to individual banks as to how they wish to handle Although talks been held recent weeks between South Africans banks completion agreement on repayments took many financial community by surprise review South Africa s economy by technical committee s economic sub committee to be held February while talks rescheduling were due to start some time month or next month However bankers because all publicity surrounds South African debt negotiations meetings were kept secret

text.title: U S HOUSE PANEL EASES SOVIET EXPORT CONTROLS
text.body: The U S House Foreign Affairs Committee voted to ease restrictions on exports now kept shipment to Soviet bloc countries but no longer threat to U S national security Democratic controlled committee administration s export control policies restrict shipment thousands products contributed to year s record billion dlr U S trade deficit committee legislation cut government red tape make easier U S companies to compete foreign producers since many goods readily available other countries Rep Don Bonker chairman International Economic Policy subcommittee unnecessary restrictions cost U S billion dlrs exports year This Congress number one opportunity to attack trade deficit positive way by exporting more Washington Democrat legislation order Commerce Department to lift controls on pct goods on restricted export list over next three years unless other countries agree to comparable controls Most these least sophisticated type technology such as medical instruments also give Commerce Department primary authority to decide exports be permitted limit Defense Department to advisory role reviewing requests to export highly sensitive technology

reuters.unknown: C G T M f reute r f BC SOUTH AFRICA CREDITO

text.title: SOUTH AFRICA CREDITOR BANKS AGREE ON DEBT PLAN
text.body: South Africa repay pct frozen billion dollar debt to foreign creditors over next three years under agreement reached today London Finance Minister Barend du Plessis He South Africa already repaid five pct debt under standstill agreement expiring on June These arrangements confirm South Africa s continued willingness to maintain good relations foreign creditors to meet foreign commitments orderly way du Plessis told news conference Du Plessis new interim debt agreement substantially continuation arrangement ending June calls South Africa to continue paying all interest on total foreign debt over billion dlrs Du Plessis banks holding more than pct frozen debt agreed to new arrangement worked out South African negotiators London other creditor banks also expected to approve agreement he Reserve Bank governor Gerhard de Kock agreement good deal both South Africa banks Speaking at same news conference de Kock three year length agreement enormous significance to South Africa He South Africa negotiated position basic economic financial strength We were never overborrowed to begin we now underborrowed by all international criteria I ve ever heard de Kock Du Plessis available foreign reserves Reserve Bank increased by dlrs past two months continued current account surplus will be sufficient to meet terms new interim debt agreement Du Plessis banks were showing much more confidence South African economy country as whole He attributed to restoration law order greatly reduced only extent unrest but also intensity unrest South Africa been under state emergency since June because black political violence claimed over lives past three years Du Plessis no political demands were made by banks South Africa now rapidly returning to very good relations foreign creditors He there were encouraging signs some foreign investors were again taking more realistic view South Africa Recent examples were rise financial rand sharp increase foreign exchange reserves he billion dlrs frozen debt billion owed by public sector billion by private industry du Plessis remaining billion consists seven billion owed by government agencies three billion by private sector
